Levitate.name: Levitate
Levitate.flavor: You rise off the ground a short distance.
Levitate.effect: You move up to 4 squares vertically and hover there until the end of your next turn. While aloft, you are unsteady, taking a -2 penalty to AC and Reflex. If some effect, such as a pit opening below you, causes you to be more than 4 squares above the ground, you drop down to 4 squares above the ground. You do not take damage from such a fall. When the levitation ends, you descend to the ground without taking falling damage.
Levitate.sustainMove: You move up to 3 squares up or down or 1 square horizontally, and you hover there until the end of your next turn. You cannot go higher than 4 squares above the ground.

Prismatic Beams.name: Prismatic Beams
Prismatic Beams.flavor: Scintillating beams of rainbow-colored light spring from your outstretched hand, affecting your foes in unpredictable ways.
Prismatic Beams.attack: Intelligence vs. Fortitude, Reflex, and Will. You make a single attack roll and use it against each defense.
Prismatic Beams.onHit (Reflex): 2d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).

Gripping Chains.name: Gripping Chains
Gripping Chains.flavor: You speak a ringing word of doleful power, enmeshing your foes in spectral bonds.
Gripping Chains.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier force damage. Until the end of your next turn, the target is slowed, and it provokes opportunity attacks when it shifts.

Stinking Cloud.name: Stinking Cloud
Stinking Cloud.flavor: You call forth a thick cloud of bilious yellow vapors. The foul fumes overwhelm any creature within.
Stinking Cloud.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is heavily obscured. Any creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 5 + your Intelligence modifier poison damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). As a move action, you can move the zone up to 6 squares.
Stinking Cloud.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Furnace of Sand.name: Furnace of Sand
Furnace of Sand.flavor: You create a powerful storm of desert winds and red-hot sand.
Furnace of Sand.effect: The burst creates a zone of red-hot swirling sand that lasts until the end of your next turn. All creatures are blinded while they are within the zone, and the area is lightly obscured. Each creature that enters the zone takes 1d10 + your Intelligence modifier fire damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Elemental Maw.name: Elemental Maw
Elemental Maw.flavor: You call up a spinning vortex of elemental energy that draws your enemies inside. It then spits them out where you direct, fallen and reeling.
keywords: Acid, Arcane, Cold, Fire, Implement, Lightning, Teleportation, Thunder, Zone
Elemental Maw.effect:
The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the origin square of the zone or starts its turn there takes 10 acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). You must teleport the creature to a square within 20 squares of you that is outside the zone. The creature then falls prone, and it is dazed until the start of your next turn.
When the zone appears, make the following attack.
Elemental Maw.onHit: 6d6 + Intelligence modifier acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage, and the target is pulled up to 2 squares toward the zone’s origin square.

Frostburn.name: Frostburn
Frostburn.flavor: You whisper a word of elemental power and hurl a flaming ball of ice. Waves of fire and ice explode outward from the point of impact.
keywords: Arcane, Cold, Evocation, Fire, Implement, Zone
Frostburn.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier cold and fire damage.
Frostburn.effect: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of your next turn or until you dismiss it as a minor action. Any creature that starts its turn in the zone takes 5 cold and fire damage.

Burning Hands.name: Burning Hands
Burning Hands.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Burning Hands.flavor: A gout of flame erupts from your hands and scorches nearby foes.

Thunderlance.name: Thunderlance
Thunderlance.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Thunderlance.flavor: A thunderous pulse of concussive energy rolls from your hand, throwing your enemies back.
Thunderlance.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and you push the target up to 4 squares.
Thunderlance.onMiss: You push the target up to 4 squares.

Color Spray.name: Color Spray
Color Spray.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Color Spray.flavor: A brilliant blast of flashing colors springs from your outstretched fingers, knocking nearby enemies senseless.
Color Spray.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Blast of Cold.name: Blast of Cold
Blast of Cold.flavor: You emit a wave of supernatural cold that freezes your enemies in place.
Blast of Cold.onHit: 6d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Blast of Cold.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).

Acid Wave.name: Acid Wave
Acid Wave.flavor: You throw out your hands and send a wave of caustic acid over your enemies. The acid continues to burn long after the wave passes.
Acid Wave.onHit: 5d6 + Intelligence modifier acid damage, and ongoing 10 acid damage (save ends).
Acid Wave.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 5 acid damage (save ends).

Evard’s Black Tentacles.name: Evard’s Black Tentacles
Evard’s Black Tentacles.flavor: Wriggling, ebon tentacles of necrotic energy erupt from the ground, grasping toward every creature within reach.
Evard’s Black Tentacles.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Evard’s Black Tentacles.effect: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of your next turn. Whenever a creature enters the zone, you can use an opportunity action to make the attack against that creature.
Evard’s Black Tentacles.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn, and each creature within the zone takes 10 necrotic damage.

Evard's Dreadful Mist.name: Evard's Dreadful Mist
Evard's Dreadful Mist.flavor: You call forth a thick, ominous fog. As it descends upon your foes, sounds of gnashing fangs and snapping claws echo from it. Something lurks within. Something horrible.
keywords: Arcane, Fear, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Zone

bonusPower.name: Evard's Dreadful Mist Attack
bonusPower.flavor: You call forth a thick, ominous fog. As it descends upon your foes, sounds of gnashing fangs and snapping claws echo from it. Something lurks within. Something horrible.
keywords: Arcane, Fear, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Zone
bonusPower.requirement: The Evard's Dreadful Mist power must be active to use this power.
bonusPower.trigger: An enemy enters the zone or starts its turn there
bonusPower.target: The triggering enemy in the burst

Evard's Dreadful Mist.onHit: The primary target is immobilized (save ends).
Evard's Dreadful Mist.onMiss: The primary target is slowed (save ends).
Evard's Dreadful Mist.effect: The burst creates a zone of thick fog that blocks line of sight until the end of your next turn. You can use the Evard's Dreadful Mist Attack power, using a square within the zone as the origin square.

Acid Storm.name: Acid Storm
Acid Storm.flavor: You create a thick, black cloud of acid droplets that burns everything inside it.
Acid Storm.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn or until you dismiss it as a minor action. The zone is heavily obscured and blocks line of sight. Any creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 10 acid damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn).

Combust.name: Combust
Combust.flavor: You cause several foes to burst into flame.

Freezing Cloud.name: Freezing Cloud
Freezing Cloud.flavor: You launch an icy pellet from your hand that explodes in a cloud of icy mist around your foes.
Freezing Cloud.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn or until you dismiss it as a minor action. Any creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 5 cold damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn).
Freezing Cloud.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Confusion.flavor: You magically compel your enemy to attack its ally.
Confusion.effect: At the start of the target’s next turn, you can use a free action to slide it a number of squares equal to its speed. It then makes a basic attack against a creature of your choice as a free action.

Crushing Titan's Fist.name: Crushing Titan's Fist
Crushing Titan's Fist.flavor: You clench your fist, crushing your enemies within a huge, invisible grip of force.
Crushing Titan's Fist.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Crushing Titan's Fist.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn or until you dismiss it as a minor action. Each square of movement that includes one or more squares of the zone costs 4 extra squares of movement.

Fire Burst.name: Fire Burst
Fire Burst.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Dragon Magazine 401, Class Compendium
Fire Burst.flavor: You send a fiery red bead streaking toward your foes, then make it burst into a great ball of magical flame.

Cloudkill.name: Cloudkill
Cloudkill.flavor: Yellow-green vapors emerge from the ground with a hiss, forming a thick, toxic cloud.
Cloudkill.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is heavily obscured. Any creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 10 + your Intelligence modifier poison damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). As a move action, you can move the zone up to 3 squares.
Cloudkill.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Ice Storm.name: Ice Storm
Ice Storm.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Class Compendium
Ice Storm.flavor: A shower of bitterly cold hailstones pummels a wide swath of ground and covers the area in ice.
Ice Storm.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Ice Storm.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).
Ice Storm.effect: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of the encounter.

Acid Mire.name: Acid Mire
Acid Mire.flavor: You transform the ground beneath your enemies’ feet to hellish slime that eats away at flesh and bone.
Acid Mire.effect: The burst creates a zone of caustic slime that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is difficult terrain. Each creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 5 acid damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). Whenever a creature falls prone within the zone, it takes 5 extra acid damage.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Lightning Bolt.flavor: Brilliant strokes of blue-white lightning erupt from your outstretched hand.

Web.name: Web
Web.flavor: You create a giant web of thick magical strands that hangs in midair, trapping those within it.
Web.effect: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any creature that ends its movement in the zone is immobilized (save ends).

Stoneskin.name: Stoneskin
Stoneskin.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Stoneskin.flavor: With an arcane word and a sprinkle of diamond dust, you imbue yourself or an ally with skin as hard as granite.
Stoneskin.effect: The target gains resist 10 to all damage until the end of the encounter.

Disintegrate.name: Disintegrate
Disintegrate.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Disintegrate.flavor: A brilliant line of ravening green energy bursts from your pointing finger. Where the emerald beam touches, flesh and bone disappear in a puff of gray dust.
Disintegrate.attack: Intelligence vs. Reflex. You automatically hit an unattended object with this power.
Disintegrate.onHit: 4d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and ongoing 10 damage (save ends).
Disintegrate.onMiss: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and ongoing 5 damage (save ends).

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, The Book of Vile Darkness, Class Compendium
Ray of Enfeeblement.flavor: You point three fingers at your foe, curling them like talons. Weird green mist streams from your enemy’s flesh, carrying away its strength.
Ray of Enfeeblement.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is weakened until the end of your next turn.

Maze.name: Maze
Maze.flavor: You trap an enemy in an extradimensional vault resembling a maze, which holds the foe until it can figure out how to escape. Where the foe vanished, a faintly glowing sigil hovers in the air.
Maze.effect: The target is removed from play. At the end of each of its turns, the target makes an Intelligence check against your Will. On a success, the target returns to play in the space it last occupied or in the nearest unoccupied space of its choice, if that space is occupied. On each failure, the target gains a cumulative +5 bonus to the check.

Otiluke’s Resilient Sphere.name: Otiluke’s Resilient Sphere
Otiluke’s Resilient Sphere.flavor: You trap your enemy in a transparent, immobile globe of impenetrable force.
Otiluke’s Resilient Sphere.attack: Intelligence vs. Reflex. If you target yourself or a willing ally, you automatically hit.
Otiluke’s Resilient Sphere.onHit: You conjure a sphere of force that encompasses the target’s space until the end of your next turn. While in the sphere, the target is immobilized and cannot attack anything outside its space. Creatures outside the sphere cannot attack the target, and the sphere blocks objects and creatures attempting to pass through it. The sphere can be attacked. It has 100 hit points, and attacks against it hit automatically.
Otiluke’s Resilient Sphere.sustainMinor: The sphere persists until the end of your next turn.

Mordenkainen’s Sword.name: Mordenkainen’s Sword
Mordenkainen’s Sword.flavor: You invoke a sword of crackling golden force that slashes and stabs furiously at a foe.
Mordenkainen’s Sword.effect: You conjure a sword of force in an unoccupied square within range, and it lasts until the end of your next turn. You then make the following attack. As a move action, you can move the sword adjacent to another creature within range.
Mordenkainen’s Sword.target: One creature adjacent to the sword
Mordenkainen’s Sword.sustainMinor: The sword persists until the end of your next turn, and you make the attack again.

Bigby’s Grasping Hands.name: Bigby’s Grasping Hands
Bigby’s Grasping Hands.flavor: Two hands of glowing golden force materialize, grab a couple of your foes, and slam them together.
Bigby’s Grasping Hands.effect:
You conjure two 5-foot-tall hands of force, each in a different unoccupied square within range. The hands occupy their squares, and they last until the end of your next turn.
When the hands appear, you make the following attack with each hand. While a hand persists, you can use a move action to move the hand to a square adjacent to a creature within range and command the hand to attack that creature. In addition, if each hand has a creature grabbed during your turn and the creatures are within 5 squares of each other, you can use a standard action to slam the hands together, pulling each of the creatures 2 squares to squares adjacent to each other, and those creatures each take 2d10 + Intelligence modifier force damage. Each hand then returns to its original square, pulling its grabbed creature with it.
Bigby’s Grasping Hands.target: One creature adjacent to the hand
Bigby’s Grasping Hands.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the hand grabs the target. The hand uses your Fortitude or Reflex if the target attempts to escape.
Bigby’s Grasping Hands.sustainMinor: The hands persist until the end of your next turn.

Icy Rays.name: Icy Rays
Icy Rays.flavor: You fire two bolts of brilliant blue-white energy that freeze your enemies in place for a short time.
Icy Rays.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Icy Rays.onMiss: The target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Mesmeric Hold.name: Mesmeric Hold
Mesmeric Hold.flavor: You command your foes to remain still, holding them in place.
Mesmeric Hold.attack: Intelligence vs. Will. You gain a +4 power bonus to the attack roll if you target only one creature.
Mesmeric Hold.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Mesmeric Hold.onMiss: The target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Class Compendium
Sleep.flavor: You exert your will against your foes, seeking to overwhelm them with a tide of magical weariness.
Sleep.firstFailedSavingThrow: The target is unconscious instead of slowed (save ends).

Spectral Ram.name: Spectral Ram
Spectral Ram.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Spectral Ram.flavor: You seize your foe with unseen magical force and bash him against the ceiling and walls before hurling it to the ground.
Spectral Ram.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you push the target up to 3 squares and knock it prone.
Spectral Ram.onMiss: You push the target up to 3 squares.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Magic Missile.flavor: A glowing blue bolt of magical energy hurtles from your finger and unerringly strikes your target.
Magic Missile.effect:
2 + Intelligence modifier force damage.
Level 11: 3 + Intelligence modifier force damage.
Level 21: 5 + Intelligence modifier force damage.
Magic Missile.special: If the implement used with this power has an enhancement bonus, add that bonus to the damage. In addition, you can use this power as a ranged basic attack.

Acid Arrow.name: Acid Arrow
Acid Arrow.flavor: You call out an arcane word and fire an arrow of green, glowing liquid that bursts against your foe and sends out a spray of sizzling acid.
Acid Arrow.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier acid damage, and ongoing 5 acid damage (save ends).
Acid Arrow.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 2 acid damage (save ends).
Acid Arrow.secondaryTarget: Each creature in the burst other than the primary target

Force Orb.name: Force Orb
Force Orb.flavor: You hurl an orb of magical force at an enemy. It bursts against the target and throws off razor-sharp shards of force that cut nearby enemies to ribbons.
Force Orb.secondaryTarget: Each enemy in the burst other than the primary target

Chain Lightning.name: Chain Lightning
Chain Lightning.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Chain Lightning.flavor: From your fingertips springs a tremendous stroke of blinding purple-white lightning that leaps from one enemy to another.
Chain Lightning.secondaryTarget: One or two creatures within 5 squares of the primary target
Chain Lightning.tertiaryTarget: Each enemy within 20 squares of you that was not a primary or a secondary target

Meteor Swarm.name: Meteor Swarm
Meteor Swarm.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Class Compendium
Meteor Swarm.flavor: Fiery orbs rain down from above, shrieking loudly as they fall. They smash into your foes, obliterating them in a storm of fire.

Lightning Serpent.name: Lightning Serpent
Lightning Serpent.flavor: A crackling bolt of lightning springs from your hand and leaps at a foe, taking serpentine form as it strikes.
Lightning Serpent.onHit: 2d12 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and the target is slowed and takes ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends both).
Lightning Serpent.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).

Displacement.name: Displacement
Displacement.flavor: You make yourself or an ally seem to be standing somewhere else, avoiding an enemy’s attack.
Displacement.trigger: A ranged or a melee attack hits you or an ally within 5 squares of you
Displacement.effect: The attacker must reroll the attack roll and use the new result.

Blur.name: Blur
Blur.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Blur.flavor: You cloak yourself with a shimmering aura, making your outline almost impossible to discern.
Blur.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses, and you are invisible to enemies 5 squares or more away from you.

Wall of Fire.name: Wall of Fire
Wall of Fire.flavor: A blazing wall of flame erupts from the ground at your command.
Wall of Fire.effect: You conjure a wall of fire that lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall can be up to 4 squares high. Any creature that starts its turn adjacent to the wall takes 1d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage. Any creature that enters the wall or starts its turn there takes 3d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). The wall blocks line of sight. Each square of movement that includes one or more squares of the wall costs 3 extra squares of movement.
Wall of Fire.sustainMinor: The wall persists until the end of your next turn.

Cloud of Daggers.name: Cloud of Daggers
Cloud of Daggers.flavor: You create a small cloud of whirling daggers of force that relentlessly attack creatures in the area.
Cloud of Daggers.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier force damage.
Level 21: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier force damage.
Cloud of Daggers.effect: The power’s area becomes a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn or until you end it as a minor action. Any creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes force damage equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Scorching Burst.name: Scorching Burst
Scorching Burst.flavor: You create a vertical column of golden flames that burns all within.
Scorching Burst.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.
Level 21: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.flavor: You fire a blisteringly cold ray of white frost at your foe, slowing its movement.
Ray of Frost.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Level 21: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.flavor: You lash your foes with a wave of thunderous power.
Thunderwave.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and you push the target a number of squares up to your Wisdom modifier.
Level 21: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage.

Chill Strike.name: Chill Strike
Chill Strike.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Chill Strike.flavor: You hit your foe with a bolt of frigid purple energy, reducing its ability to act for a moment.
Chill Strike.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
Chill Strike.onMiss: The target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Prismatic Burst.name: Prismatic Burst
Prismatic Burst.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Prismatic Burst.flavor: You lob a fist-sized orb of pulsating white light among your enemies, blasting them with rays of multicolored light.
Prismatic Burst.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage, and the target is blinded until the end of your next turn.
Prismatic Burst.onMiss: Until the end of the target’s next turn, creatures have partial concealment against the target.

Force Volley.name: Force Volley
Force Volley.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Force Volley.flavor: Silvery missiles spring from your fingertips and streak across the battlefield, striking your enemies with a staggering impact.
Force Volley.attack: Intelligence vs. Reflex. You gain a +4 power bonus to the attack roll if you target only one creature.
Force Volley.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Ice Tomb.name: Ice Tomb
Ice Tomb.flavor: You target an enemy with a freezing ray that briefly traps him in an icy sarcophagus.
Ice Tomb.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier cold damage. Until the end of your next turn, the target is stunned and outside line of effect for all attacks.
Ice Tomb.onMiss: The target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Thunderclap.name: Thunderclap
Thunderclap.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Thunderclap.flavor: You create a peal of thunder that rolls across the battlefield and slams into a foe, disorienting it for a short time.
Thunderclap.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.
Thunderclap.onMiss: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Forcecage.name: Forcecage
Forcecage.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Forcecage.flavor: You erect an invisible cage of unbreakable bars of force around your foe, trapping it momentarily.
Forcecage.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier force damage. The target is confined in the forcecage until the end of your next turn. While confined, it is immobilized, grants combat advantage, and cannot gain line of effect against nonadjacent enemies.
Forcecage.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Bigby's Icy Grasp.name: Bigby's Icy Grasp
Bigby's Icy Grasp.flavor: You conjure a giant floating hand made of chiseled ice that clutches a foe and freezes it.
Bigby's Icy Grasp.effect: You conjure a 5-foot-tall hand of ice in an unoccupied square within range. The hand lasts until the end of your next turn. When the hand appears, it immediately makes the following attack. While the hand persists and doesn’t have a creature grabbed, you can use a standard action to command it to make the attack again or a move action to move it up to 6 squares.
Bigby's Icy Grasp.target: One creature adjacent to the hand
Bigby's Icy Grasp.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the hand grabs the target. The hand uses your Fortitude or Reflex if the target attempts to escape. You can end the grab as a free action.
Bigby's Icy Grasp.sustainMinor: The hand persists until the end of your next turn, and a creature grabbed by the hand takes 1d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage.

Wall of Ice.name: Wall of Ice
Wall of Ice.flavor: A wall of glittering, jagged ice appears at your command.
Wall of Ice.effect:
You conjure a solid wall of ice in unoccupied squares. The wall can be up to 6 squares high, and it lasts for 1 hour or until it is destroyed.
Any creature that starts its turn adjacent to the wall takes 2d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage. The wall blocks line of sight and prevents movement. No creature can enter a square containing the wall.
The squares of the wall can be attacked. Each square has your defenses, and each has 50 hit points as well as vulnerable 25 fire. Any creature that makes a melee attack against the wall takes 2d6 cold damage.

Prismatic Spray.name: Prismatic Spray
Prismatic Spray.flavor: A dazzling spray of multicolored light springs from your hands, enveloping your enemies.
Prismatic Spray.attack: Intelligence vs. Fortitude, Reflex, and Will. You make a single attack roll and use it against each defense.
Prismatic Spray.onHit (Fortitude): The target is slowed and takes ongoing 15 poison damage (save ends both).
Prismatic Spray.onHit (Reflex): 3d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 15 fire damage (save ends).

Legion’s Hold.name: Legion’s Hold
Legion’s Hold.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Class Compendium
Legion’s Hold.flavor: Your eyes darken, becoming black orbs as you command your enemies to stop in their tracks.
Legion’s Hold.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed and immobilized (save ends both).
Legion’s Hold.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Dimension Door.flavor: You trace the outline of a doorway in front of you, step through the portal, and reappear somewhere else nearby.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.flavor: With a snap of your fingers, you suddenly look like someone else.
Disguise Self.effect:
You make yourself, your clothing, and your equipment look different. You can take on the appearance of any creature of similar build and size, including a specific individual whom you’ve seen. You gain neither the abilities or mannerisms of the chosen form, nor the tactile or audible properties of your form or gear. For example, if you took on the illusion of a dwarf fighter in plate armor, anyone touching you would realize you weren’t wearing plate armor, and you would not clank, creak, or jingle as you walked. The illusion lasts for 1 hour, although you can end it as a minor action. You must keep the same appearance for the entire duration.
Anyone who attempts to see through your ruse makes an Insight check opposed by your Bluff check, and you gain a +5 power bonus to your check.

Expeditious Retreat.name: Expeditious Retreat
Expeditious Retreat.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Expeditious Retreat.flavor: Your form blurs as you hastily withdraw from the battlefield.
Expeditious Retreat.effect: You shift up to twice your speed.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Feather Fall.flavor: You or a creature you choose falls gently, like a feather.
Feather Fall.trigger: You fall, or a creature within 10 squares of you falls.
Feather Fall.effect: The target takes no damage from the fall, and consequently does not fall prone at the end of it.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Fly.flavor: You leap into the air and are borne aloft on wings of magic.
Fly.effect: You gain a fly speed of 8 until the end of your next turn. When the fly speed ends, you float to the ground without taking falling damage.
Fly.sustainMinor: The fly speed persists until the end of your next turn.

Ghost Sound.name: Ghost Sound
Ghost Sound.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Ghost Sound.flavor: With a wink, you create an illusory sound that emanates from a distant location.
Ghost Sound.effect: You cause a sound as quiet as a whisper or as loud as a yelling or fighting creature to emanate from the target. You can produce nonvocal sounds such as the ringing of a sword blow, jingling armor, or scraping stone. If you whisper, you can whisper quietly enough that only creatures adjacent to the target can hear your words.

Mass Fly.name: Mass Fly
Mass Fly.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Mass Fly.flavor: White motes of light fly from your fingertips and swirl about, lifting you and your allies off the ground and granting each of you the power of flight.
Mass Fly.targets: You and each ally in the burst
Mass Fly.effect: Each target gains a fly speed of 8 until the end of your next turn. When the fly speed ends, each target floats to the ground without taking falling damage.
Mass Fly.sustainMinor: The fly speed persists until the end of your next turn.

Jump.name: Jump
Jump.flavor: You or another creature you choose can suddenly leap great distances.
Jump.effect: The target makes an Athletics check as a free action to jump with a +10 power bonus. The target can move as many squares as the check allows and is considered to have a running start.

Light.name: Light
Light.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Light.flavor: With a wave of your hand, you cause a bright light to appear on the tip of your staff, upon some other object, or in a nearby space.
Light.effect: The target sheds bright light until the end of the encounter or until you use this power again. The light fills the target’s space and all squares within 4 squares of it. Putting out the light is a free action.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Mage Hand.flavor: You gesture toward an object nearby, and a spectral floating hand lifts the object into the air and moves it where you wish.
Mage Hand.effect: You conjure a spectral, floating hand in an unoccupied square within range. The hand lasts until the end of your next turn or until you use this power again. If you are holding an object when you use this power, the hand can move the object into a pack, a pouch, a sheath, or a similar container and simultaneously move any one object carried or worn anywhere on your body into your hand. While the hand persists, you can take the following actions.
Mage Hand.minorAction: The hand picks up or manipulates an object weighing 20 pounds or less. It can hold only one object at a time.
Mage Hand.moveAction: The hand moves up to 5 squares in any direction, carrying the object it holds.
Mage Hand.freeAction: The hand drops the object it is holding.
Mage Hand.sustainMinor: The hand persists until the end of your next turn.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Invisibility.flavor: A creature you choose vanishes from sight.
Invisibility.effect: The target becomes invisible until the end of your next turn. If the target makes an attack, the invisibility ends.
Invisibility.sustainStandard: If the target is within 5 squares of you, the invisibility persists until the end of your next turn.

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Mirror Image.flavor: Three duplicate images of you appear, imitating your actions perfectly and confusing your enemies.
Mirror Image.effect: Three duplicate images of yourself appear in your space, and you gain a +6 power bonus to AC. Each time an attack misses you, one of your duplicate images disappears, and the bonus granted by this power decreases by 2. When the bonus reaches 0, all your images are gone and the power ends. Otherwise, the effect lasts for 1 hour.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Shield.flavor: You throw up your hand, and a shield of arcane energy springs into existence, protecting you against imminent attacks.
Shield.trigger: You are hit by an attack.
Shield.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to AC and Reflex until the end of your next turn.

Time Stop.name: Time Stop
Time Stop.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Time Stop.flavor: Everything around you slows to a halt, frozen in time. Then, after a few moments, everything starts to speed up again, returning to normal time.
Time Stop.effect: You gain two extra standard actions, which you must use before the end of your turn. You can’t use these extra actions to make attacks.

Icy Terrain.name: Icy Terrain
Icy Terrain.flavor: You coat the ground with a treacherous patch of ice that freezes and hampers your foes.
Icy Terrain.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target falls prone.
Icy Terrain.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn or until you end it as a minor action. The ground of the zone is difficult terrain.

Winter’s Wrath.name: Winter’s Wrath
Winter’s Wrath.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Winter’s Wrath.flavor: You raise your hand, and an icy blizzard rains down mercilessly upon an area you designate.
Winter’s Wrath.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn or until you dismiss it as a minor action. The zone is lightly obscured, and any creature that starts its turn in the zone takes cold damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Flaming Sphere.name: Flaming Sphere
Flaming Sphere.flavor: You conjure a rolling ball of fire and control where it goes.
Flaming Sphere.effect:
You conjure a Medium flaming sphere in an unoccupied square within range. The sphere occupies its square, and it lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that starts its turn adjacent to the sphere takes 1d4 + Intelligence modifier fire damage. As a move action, you can move the sphere up to 6 squares.
When the sphere appears, it immediately makes the following attack. While the sphere persists, you can use a standard action to command it to make the attack.
Flaming Sphere.target: One creature adjacent to the flaming sphere
Flaming Sphere.sustainMinor: The sphere persists until the end of your next turn.

Shock Sphere.name: Shock Sphere
Shock Sphere.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Shock Sphere.flavor: You hurl a crackling orb of lightning that explodes at a point you designate, engulfing all nearby creatures in its electric embrace.

Arcane Gate.name: Arcane Gate
Arcane Gate.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Arcane Gate.flavor: You open a dimensional rift connecting two nearby locations.
Arcane Gate.effect: You create a dimensional rift between two unoccupied squares in range. The rift lasts until the end of your next turn. Until the rift ends, the two squares are effectively adjacent to each other, but for movement only.
Arcane Gate.sustainMinor: The rift persists until the end of your next turn.

Wall of Fog.name: Wall of Fog
Wall of Fog.flavor: You create a billowing wall of gray fog that obscures vision.
Wall of Fog.effect: You conjure a wall of fog that lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall can be up to 4 squares high. The wall is heavily obscured and blocks line of sight.
Wall of Fog.sustainMinor: The wall persists until the end of your next turn.

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.flavor: With a wave of your hand, you or another creature nearby fades away, becoming invisible.
Greater Invisibility.effect: The target is invisible until the end of your next turn or until it attacks.
Greater Invisibility.sustainMinor: If the target is in range, the invisibility persists until the end of your next turn.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Class Compendium
Fireball.flavor: A globe of orange flame coalesces in your hand. You hurl it at your enemies, and it explodes on impact.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Prestidigitation.flavor: You perform an amusing magical trick, such as creating a dancing wisp of light, freshening a wilting flower, making a coin invisible, or warming a cold drink.
Prestidigitation.effect:
Use this cantrip to accomplish one of the effects given below:
Change the color of items in 1 cubic foot.
Create a harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint music, or a strong odor.
Clean or soil items in 1 cubic foot.
Instantly light (or snuff out) a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
Chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 pound of nonliving material for up to 1 hour.
Make a small mark or symbol appear on a surface for up to 1 hour.
Produce out of nothingness a small item or image that exists until the end of your next turn.
Make a small, handheld item invisible until the end of your next turn.
Prestidigitation.special: You can have as many as three prestidigitation effects active at one time. Nothing you create with this cantrip can deal damage, serve as a weapon or a tool, or hinder another creature’s actions. This cantrip cannot duplicate the effect of any other power.

Fire Shroud.name: Fire Shroud
Fire Shroud.flavor: With a subtle gesture, you wreathe nearby enemies in flames.
Fire Shroud.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Class Compendium
Dispel Magic.flavor: You send out a ray of crackling arcane energy that destroys a magical effect created by an opponent.
Dispel Magic.attack: Intelligence vs. Will defense of the creator of the conjuration or the zone
Dispel Magic.onHit: The conjuration or zone is destroyed. All its effects end, including those that normally last until a target saves.

Resistance.name: Resistance
Resistance.flavor: You make yourself or another creature in range resistant to a particular kind of damage.
Resistance.effect: Choose acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. The target gains resistance to that damage type until the end of the encounter. The resistance equals your level + your Intelligence modifier.

Mordenkainen’s Mansion.name: Mordenkainen’s Mansion
Mordenkainen’s Mansion.flavor: You trace the outline of a door, and a shimmering portal appears, leading to a space accessible only by you and your allies.
Mordenkainen’s Mansion.effect: You conjure a spacious extradimensional dwelling that can hold up to fifty Medium creatures. It is reached through a single doorway that you trace on a surface or in the air. Only you and those you designate can pass through it. You can close the entrance and make it invisible after you enter the mansion, and only someone inside the mansion can open the portal once it’s closed. The mansion contains comfortable furnishings and enough food and drink to satisfy its denizens. The furniture and food disappear if removed from the mansion. The mansion lasts for 8 hours, and any creatures still in the mansion when the power ends reappear in unoccupied squares outside the entrance portal.

Necrotic Web.name: Necrotic Web
Necrotic Web.flavor: You cover your enemies in a giant web made from strands of black, life-draining energy.
Necrotic Web.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Necrotic Web.effect: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any creature that starts its turn in the zone takes 4d6 necrotic damage, and is slowed (save ends).

Black Fire.name: Black Fire
Black Fire.sourceRef: Player's Handbook, Neverwinter Campaign Setting, Class Compendium
Black Fire.flavor: A blast of crackling black fire erupts from your hand, charring your foes’ flesh and burning their souls.
Black Fire.onHit: 6d6 + Intelligence modifier fire and necrotic damage.

Greater Ice Storm.name: Greater Ice Storm
Greater Ice Storm.flavor: You mount a storm of bitterly cold hailstones that pummels a wide swath of ground and covers the area in ice.
Greater Ice Storm.onHit: 4d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Greater Ice Storm.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).
Greater Ice Storm.effect: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of the encounter.

Grease.name: Grease
Grease.flavor: Slippery oil floods the ground under your foes, sending them tumbling to the ground.

bonusPower.name: Grease Attack
bonusPower.flavor: Slippery oil floods the ground under your foes, sending them tumbling to the ground.
bonusPower.requirement: The Grease power must be active to use this power.
bonusPower.target: The triggering creature in the burst
bonusPower.onMiss: You slide the target 2 squares. This movement does not trigger this power’s attack.

Grease.effect: The burst creates a zone of slick grease that covers all horizontal surfaces until the end of the encounter. The zone is difficult terrain. You can use the Grease Attack power, using a square within the zone as the origin square.

Glitterdust.name: Glitterdust
Glitterdust.flavor: You call forth a flash of brilliant light that leaves golden dust on all nearby creatures. The dust sparkles with a supernatural luster.
Glitterdust.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage, and the target is blinded until the end of your next turn.
Glitterdust.effect: The target gains no benefit from concealment or invisibility, nor can it become hidden (save ends).

Mirror Sphere.name: Mirror Sphere
Mirror Sphere.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Mirror Sphere.flavor: Illusory barriers surround your foe, causing it phantom pain when it attacks you and your allies.
Mirror Sphere.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage. The first time the target makes an attack before the end of its next turn, it automatically hits itself with the attack, in addition to hitting or missing the attack’s intended targets. The target’s resistances and immunities do not apply against that attack.
Mirror Sphere.onMiss: The next time the target makes an attack before the end of its next turn, that attack automatically deals half damage to the target, in addition to whatever damage is dealt to the attack’s intended targets. The target’s resistances and immunities do not apply to this damage.

Twist of Space.name: Twist of Space
Twist of Space.flavor: You bend and fold the fabric of space, scattering your enemies across the battlefield.
Twist of Space.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is teleported 3 squares and slowed until the end of your next turn.

Bubbling Acid.name: Bubbling Acid
Bubbling Acid.flavor: You toss a green globe toward your enemies. It explodes, showering them with acid and creating a boiling pool of caustic stuff that moves at your command.

bonusPower.name: Bubbling Acid Attack
bonusPower.flavor: You toss a green globe toward your enemies. It explodes, showering them with acid and creating a boiling pool of caustic stuff that moves at your command.
bonusPower.requirement: The Bubbling Acid power must be active to use this power.
bonusPower.trigger: A creature enters the zone or starts its turn there
bonusPower.target: The triggering creature in the burst
bonusPower.onHit: The secondary target is blinded until the end of its current turn.

Bubbling Acid.effect:
The burst creates a zone of bubbling acid that lasts until the end of the encounter. Each creature that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 10 acid damage (a creature can take this damage only once per turn). As a move action, you can move the zone up to 5 squares.
You can use the Bubbling Acid Attack power, using a square within the zone as the origin square.

Miasma of Enfeeblement.name: Miasma of Enfeeblement
Miasma of Enfeeblement.flavor: Black dust whirls up around your foes, sapping their strength and clouding their vision.
Miasma of Enfeeblement.onHit: 5d6 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is weakened (save ends).
Miasma of Enfeeblement.effect: The burst creates a zone of clinging black dust that blocks line of sight for all creatures damaged by this power until the end of your next turn.

Stonewrack.name: Stonewrack
Stonewrack.flavor: You clench your fists as you call on the earth to obey you. The ground buckles amid your foes, creating a mass of jagged rocks.
Stonewrack.effect: The burst creates a zone of jagged stone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Each creature that moves into the zone or within it without shifting or crawling takes 2d6 damage and is knocked prone. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Cinder Storm.name: Cinder Storm
Cinder Storm.flavor: A spinning cloud of flaming ash surrounds your enemies, burning them and blinding their allies.

bonusPower.name: Cinder Storm Attack
bonusPower.flavor: A spinning cloud of flaming ash surrounds your enemies, burning them and blinding their allies.
bonusPower.requirement: The Cinder Storm power must be active to use this power.
bonusPower.trigger: A creature fails its saving throw against this power’s ongoing damage
bonusPower.target: The triggering creature in the burst
bonusPower.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and the secondary target is blinded until the end of its next turn.

Cinder Storm.onHit: 5d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends).
Cinder Storm.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).
Cinder Storm.effect: The burst creates a zone of flaming ash that lasts until the end of your next turn. You can use the Cinder Storm Attack power, using a square within the zone as the origin square.

Ball Lightning.name: Ball Lightning
Ball Lightning.flavor: A coruscating globe of lightning flashes forth and flies about, lashing out with tendrils of electricity.
Ball Lightning.effect: You conjure a Medium ball of lightning that occupies 1 square within range, and the ball makes the following attack, which is a close burst 1. Each creature that starts its turn adjacent to the ball is slowed until the end of your next turn. Once per round, as a minor action, you can have the ball repeat its attack. As a move action, you can move the ball up to 10 squares. It can fly and hover. The ball lasts until the end of the encounter or until you dismiss it with a free action.

Evard's Ebon Bindings.name: Evard's Ebon Bindings
Evard's Ebon Bindings.flavor: With incantations of imprisonment, you trap your foe in writhing black runes that seem almost alive, forcing it to obey your command.
Evard's Ebon Bindings.aftereffect: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is immobilized and dazed until the end of your next turn.
Evard's Ebon Bindings.onMiss: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.

Prismatic Wall.name: Prismatic Wall
Prismatic Wall.flavor: You draw your hands apart to form a mystic rainbow, which grows into a wall of shimmering colors.
keywords: Arcane, Conjuration, Evocation, Fire, Implement, Poison

bonusPower.name: Prismatic Wall Attack
bonusPower.flavor: You draw your hands apart to form a mystic rainbow, which grows into a wall of shimmering colors.
keywords: Arcane, Conjuration, Evocation, Fire, Implement, Poison
bonusPower.requirement: The Prismatic Wall power must be active to use this power.
bonusPower.trigger: A creature starts its turn inside the wall or adjacent to the wall or moves through it
bonusPower.target: The triggering creature in the burst
bonusPower.onHit (Fortitude): 3d4 + Intelligence modifier poison damage, and you teleport the target 5 squares.
bonusPower.onHit (Reflex): 2d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends).

Prismatic Wall.effect:
You conjure a wall of contiguous squares filled with many-colored light that lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall can be up to 5 squares high. Entering a square occupied by the wall costs 1 extra square of movement. The wall blocks line of sight.
You can use the Prismatic Wall Attack power, using a square within the zone as the origin square.
Prismatic Wall.special: You make one attack roll per target and compare that result against all three defenses. A target might be subject to any, all, or none of the effects depending on how many of its defenses were hit. The target must roll a saving throw against each condition or instance of ongoing damage separately.

Fire Shield.name: Fire Shield
Fire Shield.flavor: You are swathed in rippling flames that turn away both fire and chill but scorch anyone who strikes you.
Fire Shield.effect: You gain resist 10 cold and resist 10 fire until the end of the encounter. Whenever a creature makes a melee attack roll against you, it takes 2d6 + your Intelligence modifier fire damage. No creature can take this damage more than once per turn.

Phase Shift.name: Phase Shift
Phase Shift.flavor: You whisper an arcane phrase and transform your body into a mere phantom.
Phase Shift.effect: You become insubstantial and gain phasing until the end of your next turn.

Wall of Force.name: Wall of Force
Wall of Force.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Wall of Force.flavor: A transparent barrier of force springs up where you command.
Wall of Force.effect:
You conjure a solid, transparent wall of magical energy that lasts until the end of the encounter. The wall can be up to 6 squares high. The wall is blocking terrain. No creature, including a phasing creature, can enter a square of the wall.
Attacks against the wall automatically hit. The wall has 200 hit points, and attacking any square deals damage to the entire wall. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, the wall shatters, dealing 3d10 force damage to each creature adjacent to it.

Mass Resistance.name: Mass Resistance
Mass Resistance.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Mass Resistance.flavor: You wrap arcane strands about yourself and all your allies, insulating all against a particular type of damage.
Mass Resistance.target: You and each ally in the burst
Mass Resistance.effect: Choose acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. Until the end of the encounter, each target gains resistance to that damage type equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier.

Globe of Invulnerability.name: Globe of Invulnerability
Globe of Invulnerability.flavor: A transparent bubble of force appears around you, preventing anything from getting in or out.
Globe of Invulnerability.effect:
You create a globe of force around you that lasts until the end of your next turn. Whenever you move (including teleportation), the globe moves with you. You cannot gain line of effect to any target other than yourself, and no creature or effect can gain line of effect to you. The globe doesn’t block line of sight. It blocks objects and creatures attempting to pass through it.
The globe, although impenetrable, is not impervious to damage. Attacks against the globe automatically hit, and it has 100 hit points.

True Seeing.name: True Seeing
True Seeing.flavor: Your eyes glow with arcane light, letting nothing escape your sight.
True Seeing.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you gain darkvision, and you can see invisible creatures and objects wthin 10 squares of you that are within your line of sight. You also gain a +5 power bonus to Insight checks and Perception checks.

Illusory Ambush.name: Illusory Ambush
Illusory Ambush.flavor: You create an illusion of swirling spectral assailants that swarm over your enemy.
Illusory Ambush.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target takes a –2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Increase damage to 2d6 + Intelligence modifier at 21st level.

Grasping Shadows.name: Grasping Shadows
Grasping Shadows.flavor: At your command, the shadows reach out, grab hold of your foes, and wreath the area in darkness.
Grasping Shadows.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Grasping Shadows.effect: Shadows writhe in the designated area and continue until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the area of the grasping shadows takes psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier and is slowed until the end of its next turn. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Phantom Chasm.name: Phantom Chasm
Phantom Chasm.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Phantom Chasm.flavor: Your enemies shriek in terror as, at least in their mind’s eye, a bottomless pit opens beneath their feet.
Phantom Chasm.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target falls prone. The target is immobilized until the end of its next turn.
Phantom Chasm.onMiss: Half damage, and the target falls prone.
Phantom Chasm.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any enemy that enters the zone falls prone.

Phantasmal Terrain.name: Phantasmal Terrain
Phantasmal Terrain.flavor: You make already treacherous terrain even more difficult for your enemies to traverse.
Phantasmal Terrain.effect: Until the end of the encounter, difficult terrain in the designated area costs 2 extra squares of movement instead of the normal 1 extra square for your enemies. Additionally, hazards and traps within the area gain a bonus to attack rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier against your enemies.

Maze of Mirrors.name: Maze of Mirrors
Maze of Mirrors.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Maze of Mirrors.flavor: You envelop your enemies in an illusory labyrinth of mirrors, which conceals the world around them.
Maze of Mirrors.onHit: The target is immobilized and takes a -4 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Maze of Mirrors.onMiss: The target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Phantasmal Assailant.name: Phantasmal Assailant
Phantasmal Assailant.flavor: You craft an elaborate image of a deadly assassin whose blade cuts deeply into your foes.
Phantasmal Assailant.effect: The target takes ongoing 5 psychic damage and grants combat advantage to all your allies (save ends both).

Spectral Hound.name: Spectral Hound
Spectral Hound.flavor: You summon the ghostly image of a powerful mastiff that follows you protectively.
Spectral Hound.effect: You create the illusion a spectral hound, which appears in a square you designate within range. The spectral hound does not occupy that square but does count as an ally for the purposes of flanking. Additionally, as long as the hound remains within 10 squares of you, you gain a +1 power bonus to AC and all defenses, along with a +5 power bonus to Perception checks, since the spectral hound warns you of approaching danger.
Spectral Hound.sustainMinor: You can sustain this power until the end of the encounter. Each round you can move the hound up to 5 squares as a free action; the spectral hound ignores difficult terrain but the effect ends if the hound leaves your line of sight.

Enemies Abound.name: Enemies Abound
Enemies Abound.flavor: You weave a veil of illusion over the eyes your enemies, causing them to view their allies as threats.
Enemies Abound.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and you and your allies can treat the target as an ally for the purposes of flanking until the end of your next turn.

Illusory Wall.name: Illusory Wall
Illusory Wall.flavor: A seemingly solid wall materializes before your foes, dividing the battlefield with your convincing illusion.
Illusory Wall.effect: You create the illusion of a contiguous wall of solid material (stone or metal, for example). The wall can be up to 8 squares long and 4 squares high, and it lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall blocks line of sight for all enemies (but not your allies). When any enemy moves adjacent to the wall, you can make an attack (Intelligence vs. Will) against that target; if successful, the target cannot move through the wall on its current turn, but it can try again on later turns. On a miss, the wall no longer blocks line of sight or movement for that creature.
Illusory Wall.sustainMinor: You can sustain this power until the end of the encounter.

Summon Fire Warrior.name: Summon Fire Warrior
Summon Fire Warrior.flavor: A soldier of flame strides through a planar veil. It lifts a shimmering axe above its head as it moves to attack.
Summon Fire Warrior.effect: You summon a Medium fire warrior in an unoccupied square within range. The fire warrior has a speed of fly 6 (hover). It has a +2 bonus to AC and a +2 bonus to Fortitude. You can give the fire warrior the following special commands.
Summon Fire Warrior.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.
Summon Fire Warrior.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.

Astral Wasp.name: Astral Wasp
Astral Wasp.flavor: A crystalline wasp with gossamer wings appears next to your foe and stings it, then buzzes about, waiting for another opening to attack.
Astral Wasp.effect:
You conjure an astral wasp that appears in 1 square within the target’s space. It lasts until the end of your next turn.
If the target moves out of the astral wasp’s square, it takes damage equal to your Constitution modifier. If the target ends its turn more than 2 squares away from the astral wasp, it takes damage equal to your Constitution modifier.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.flavor: A swirling pattern of colors appears before your foes. Their eyes glaze over as the pattern enthralls them and lures them closer.
Hypnotic Pattern.effect: You conjure a swirling pattern of colors and lights in an unoccupied square within range that lasts until the end of your next turn. You can use the Hypnotic Pattern Attack power, using the pattern’s square as the origin square.
Hypnotic Pattern.requirement: The Hypnotic Pattern power must be active to use this power.
Hypnotic Pattern.trigger: An enemy starts its turn within 3 squares of the pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Hypnotic Pattern.onHit: The target is pulled 3 squares toward the pattern and is slowed until the end of your next turn. It can move into the pattern’s square.

Shock Beetle Swarm.name: Shock Beetle Swarm
Shock Beetle Swarm.flavor: A sudden mass of insects limned with lightning crawls over your foes. Energy arcs between your enemies as the swarm feasts on their flesh.
Shock Beetle Swarm.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and you conjure a shock beetle in 1 square within the target’s space. Each beetle lasts until the end of your next turn. Each enemy that starts its turn in or adjacent to at least 1 square containing a shock beetle takes lightning damage equal to your Constitution modifier.

Chill Claws.name: Chill Claws
Chill Claws.flavor: Skeletal hands appear around your targets, ripping into them with icy claws and sapping their will to fight.
Chill Claws.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Worms of Minauros.name: Worms of Minauros
Worms of Minauros.flavor: You drop a mass of writhing maggots onto your enemy. The horrors feast on its flesh, dissolving it with acidic drool.
Worms of Minauros.effect: You conjure a mass of worms in 1 square within the target’s space. They last until the end of your next turn.
Worms of Minauros.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier acid damage. If the target ends its turn within 2 squares of the worms, it takes 10 acid damage.

Phantasmal Horror.name: Phantasmal Horror
Phantasmal Horror.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Phantasmal Horror.flavor: Your enemy is assailed by an imaginary monster ripped from its nightmares, frightening it into a catatonic state.
Phantasmal Horror.onHit: The target is stunned until the end of your next turn. While the target is stunned by this power, you gain a +4 power bonus to damage rolls against it.
Phantasmal Horror.onMiss: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Earth Brute.name: Earth Brute
Earth Brute.flavor: The ground creaks and moans, and a creature of rock and earth emerges to smash your foes.
Earth Brute.onHit:
2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you slide the target 3 squares. You conjure a Medium earth brute in a square adjacent to the target after this movement. The earth brute occupies 1 square and lasts until the end of your next turn.
Whenever a creature starts its turn in or willingly enters a square adjacent to the earth brute, that creature takes 5 damage, and the earth brute pushes it 1 square.

Taunting Phantoms.name: Taunting Phantoms
Taunting Phantoms.flavor: Your foes are beset by tormenting images that dart among them, daring them to attack and driving them to lash out with reckless abandon.
Taunting Phantoms.onHit: The target makes a melee basic attack roll against a creature of your choice, including itself.
Taunting Phantoms.effect: The target takes 5 damage each time it misses with a melee attack (save ends).

Shard of the Endless Avalanche.name: Shard of the Endless Avalanche
Shard of the Endless Avalanche.flavor: You conjure a massive boulder from the Elemental Chaos that smashes through your enemies’ ranks, then shatters and dissipates.

bonusPower.name: Shard of the Endless Avalanche Attack
bonusPower.flavor: You conjure a massive boulder from the Elemental Chaos that smashes through your enemies’ ranks, then shatters and dissipates.
bonusPower.requirement: The Shard of the Endless Avalanche power must be active to use this power.
bonusPower.trigger: The boulder enters a creature’s space
bonusPower.target: The creature whose space was entered
bonusPower.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you slide the target 2 squares.

Shard of the Endless Avalanche.effect: You conjure a Medium boulder that appears in 1 square within range, and you move it 5 squares. At the end of this movement, the boulder disappears. While it moves, you can use the Shard of the Endless Avalanche Attack power.
Shard of the Endless Avalanche.special: The boulder can attack any single creature only once, even if it enters that creature’s space multiple times.

Soul Fire.name: Soul Fire
Soul Fire.flavor: You crook your hand in a mystical gesture, and your foes shriek in agony as their souls are consumed by hidden flame.
Soul Fire.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier fire and necrotic damage, and the target is weakened until the end of your next turn.

Sequestering Force.name: Sequestering Force
Sequestering Force.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Sequestering Force.flavor: Your spell rips apart planar boundaries, battering your enemies and trapping them in a fold of buckled space.
Sequestering Force.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. No creature can leave the zone by any means, including forced movement and teleportation.

Deceptive Shadows.name: Deceptive Shadows
Deceptive Shadows.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Deceptive Shadows.flavor: Darkness swirls around your foes, assaulting their minds and clouding their vision.
Deceptive Shadows.effect: Until the end of your next turn, each target cannot see any creatures that are not adjacent to it.

Lost in the Mists.name: Lost in the Mists
Lost in the Mists.flavor: You create a phantom world around your enemy and mimic reality so closely that you manipulate the foe as if it were a puppet.
Lost in the Mists.onHit: The target is dominated until the end of your next turn. While dominated, it gains a bonus to its attack rolls and damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier.

Steal Time.name: Steal Time
Steal Time.flavor: You divert the river of time, stealing a moment from your enemy for your own use.
Steal Time.onHit: The target is stunned until the end of your next turn. You gain an extra standard action, which you must use before the target recovers frm this stunned condition.

Visions of Ruin.name: Visions of Ruin
Visions of Ruin.flavor: Your foes scream in terror as a great cataclysm seems to destroy the world around them. Only the small area they occupy is safe from the horrid destruction they witness.
keywords: Arcane, Fear, Illusion, Implement, Psychic, Zone
Visions of Ruin.effect: The burst creates a zone of illusory safety. A target that is forced to leave the zone takes 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and this effect ends for it. The zone lasts until no creature is subject to this effect.
Visions of Ruin.onHit: The target is affected by visions of ruin (save ends). While affected by visions of ruin, it cannot voluntarily leave the zone, and it does not have line of sight to targets outside the zone.
Visions of Ruin.onMiss: Until the end of your next turn, the target cannot voluntarily leave the zone, and it does not have line of sight to targets outside the zone.
Visions of Ruin.special: A creature whose space is partly within the zone can move only into squares within the zone.

Visions of Avarice.name: Visions of Avarice
Visions of Avarice.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Visions of Avarice.flavor: The illusion of a fabulous treasure appears out of thin air. Your enemies throw aside caution to seize it.

bonusPower.name: Visions of Avarice Attack
bonusPower.flavor: The illusion of a fabulous treasure appears out of thin air. Your enemies throw aside caution to seize it.
bonusPower.range: Close burst 5 centered on the zone
bonusPower.requirement: The Visions of Avarice power must be active to use this power.
bonusPower.onHit: You pull the secondary target up to 4 squares toward the zone.

Visions of Avarice.effect: The burst creates a zone in its origin square. The zone lasts until the end of your next turn. You then make the primary attack.
Visions of Avarice.onHit: You pull the primary target up to 4 squares toward the zone. If the primary target is then in the zone or adjacent to it, the primary target is immobilized (save ends).
Visions of Avarice.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn, and you make the secondary attack.

Summon Abyssal Maw.name: Summon Abyssal Maw
Summon Abyssal Maw.flavor: The air is filled with the sound of gnashing teeth as a voracious creature of the Elemental Chaos appears and chews into anything it can reach.
Summon Abyssal Maw.effect: You summon a Medium abyssal maw in an unoccupied square within range. The maw has a speed of 6. You can give the maw the following special commands.
Summon Abyssal Maw.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d6 + Intelligence modifier damage.
Summon Abyssal Maw.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d8 + Intelligence modifier damage. In addition, if an enemy adjacent to the maw makes a melee attack that does not include the maw as a target, the maw can make an opportunity attack against that enemy after the enemy’s attack is resolved.

Summon Arrowhawk.name: Summon Arrowhawk
Summon Arrowhawk.flavor: With a mighty shriek, a four-winged creature of the Elemental Chaos appears above your foes and swoops in to attack.
Summon Arrowhawk.effect: You summon a Medium arrowhawk in an unoccupied square within range. The arrowhawk has a speed of fly 8 (hover). It has a +2 bonus to AC and a +2 bonus to Reflex. You can give the arrowhawk the following special commands.
Summon Arrowhawk.standardAction: Shift 3 squares and attack; melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is marked by the arrowhawk until the end of your next turn.
Summon Arrowhawk.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is marked by the arrowhawk until the end of your next turn.

Mordenkainen's Guardian Hound.name: Mordenkainen's Guardian Hound
Mordenkainen's Guardian Hound.flavor: The ghostly form of a snarling wolfhound appears before you and leaps into the fray.
Mordenkainen's Guardian Hound.effect: You conjure a Medium guardian hound that occupies 1 square within range, and the hound makes the following melee attack. Once per round as a minor action, you can have the hound repeat its attack. As a minor action, you can move the hound 6 squares. The hound lasts until the end of the encounter or until you dismiss it with a free action.
Mordenkainen's Guardian Hound.target: One creature adjacent to the hound
Mordenkainen's Guardian Hound.onHit: 3d4 + Intelligence modifier damage. The target takes a -2 penalty to its next attack roll that targets you.

Summon Chainbearer.name: Summon Chainbearer
Summon Chainbearer.flavor: A blast of wind rushes over the battlefield as a dozen gleaming chains soar from your outstretched hand and wrap themselves into a humanoid form that lashes your enemies.
Summon Chainbearer.effect: You summon a Large creature made of chains in an unoccupied 2-square-by-2-square space within range. The chainbearer has reach 2 and a speed of 6. It has a +4 bonus to AC and a +4 bonus to Fortitude. You can give the chainbearer the following special commands.
Summon Chainbearer.standardAction: Melee 2; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Fortitude; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you slide the target 2 squares.
Summon Chainbearer.opportunityAttack: Melee 2; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Fortitude; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you slide the target 2 squares. The chainbearer has threatening reach, allowing it to make opportunity attacks against targets within its reach of 2 squares.

Vertigo.name: Vertigo
Vertigo.flavor: Your enemies stagger and flail their arms as the world seems to spin furiously around them.
Vertigo.onHit: The target is affected by vertigo (save ends). While affected by vertigo, the target can’t stand up from prone, and if it moves, the target must move at least 4 squares or it falls prone at the end of its movement.
Vertigo.aftereffect: The target is affected by a lesser form of vertigo (save ends). While affected, the target can’t stand up from prone, and if it moves, the target must move at least 2 squares or it falls prone at the end of its movement.
Vertigo.onMiss: Until the end of your next turn, the target can’t stand up from prone, and if it moves, the target must move at least 2 squares or it falls prone at the end of its movement.
Vertigo.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target provokes opportunity attacks when it shifts.

Summon Black Devourer.name: Summon Black Devourer
Summon Black Devourer.flavor: Your fingers claw open an inky portal and draw forth a terror of solid darkness: a razor-toothed maw surrounded by dozens of whipping tentacles.
Summon Black Devourer.effect: You summon a Large black devourer in an unoccupied 2-square-by-2-square space within range. The black devourer has reach 2 and a speed of 5. It has a +4 bonus to AC and a +4 bonus to Will. You can give the black devourer the following special commands.
Summon Black Devourer.standardAction: Melee 2; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d4 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is grabbed. The devourer gains a +4 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls against a target it is already grabbing.
Summon Black Devourer.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is knocked prone.

Plague of Illusions.name: Plague of Illusions
Plague of Illusions.flavor: You invade your enemy’s mind to produce a bewildering array of illusions: nightmares sprung to life, gaping rifts in the ground, and hissing, encircling snakes.
Plague of Illusions.onHit: The target cannot use attack powers (save ends).

Summon Living Mountain.name: Summon Living Mountain
Summon Living Mountain.flavor: You part the planar walls to call a sentient mass of living rock from the Elemental Chaos. It emerges to crush your foes beneath its granite feet.
Summon Living Mountain.effect: You summon a Huge living mountain in a 3-squareby-3-square unoccupied space within range. The living mountain has a speed of 3. It has a +4 bonus to AC and a +4 bonus to Fortitude. You can give the living mountain the following special commands.
Summon Living Mountain.standardAction: Close burst 5; targets enemies only; Intelligence vs. Fortitude; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is knocked prone.
Summon Living Mountain.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Fortitude; 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage.

Phantom Reality.name: Phantom Reality
Phantom Reality.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Phantom Reality.flavor: You create an intricate illusion in your enemy’s mind, convincing it that friends are foes and leading it wherever you desire.
Phantom Reality.onHit: The target is subjected to a phantom reality until the end of the encounter.
Phantom Reality.onMiss: The target is subjected to a phantom reality until the end of its next turn.
Phantom Reality.effect: While the target is subjected to the phantom reality, it must make a saving throw whenever it uses an attack power. If the saving throw fails, you can either force the target to attack one creature instead of another or change the location of the attack power’s area of effect, if any. Either change must be valid for the power, and you cannot force the target to attack itself. In addition, whenever the target ends a move, you can slide it up to 4 squares as a free action.

Summon Abyssal Horde.name: Summon Abyssal Horde
Summon Abyssal Horde.flavor: Three horrid creatures, little more than living toothy mouths, appear around your foes to devour them.
Summon Abyssal Horde.effect: You summon up to three Medium abyssal maws, each appearing in an unoccupied square within range. Each maw has a speed of 6. You can give the maws the following special commands.
Summon Abyssal Horde.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d6 + Intelligence modifier damage.
Summon Abyssal Horde.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d6 + Intelligence modifier damage. In addition, if an enemy adjacent to the maw makes a melee attack that does not include the maw as a target, the maw makes an opportunity attack against that enemy after the enemy’s attack is resolved.
Summon Abyssal Horde.special: Whenever you use a standard action or a minor action to issue a command, all the summoned maws take that action. Only one maw within range of a target can make an opportunity attack against that target. You do not lose a healing surge until all the maws summoned by this power are reduced to 0 hit points or fewer.

Float.name: Float
Float.flavor: You rise a few inches above the ground and glide over minor hindrances.
Float.effect: You hover 6 inches above the ground until the end of the encounter or until you fall. You ignore movement penalties and restrictions due to terrain, do not set off pressure-sensitive traps, and cannot be detected with tremorsense. You also gain a bonus to Stealth checks equal to your Wisdom modifier. You can float over only a solid surface or a liquid surface directly beneath you.
