For example, you cannot use this power to cross a chasm or a pit; if you try to do so, you fall normally.

Summon Shadow Serpent.name: Summon Shadow Serpent
Summon Shadow Serpent.flavor: Shadows flicker at your feet, swirl before you, and coalesce into the form of a black serpent.
Summon Shadow Serpent.effect:
You summon a shadow serpent in an unoccupied square within range. The creature is an ally to you and your allies.
The serpent lacks actions of its own. Instead, you spend actions to command it mentally, choosing from the actions in its description. You don’t need line of effect to the serpent to command it. When you command the serpent, the two of you share knowledge but not senses.
When the serpent makes a check, you make the roll using your game statistics, not including temporary bonuses or penalties.
The serpent lasts until it drops to 0 hit points, at which point you lose a healing surge (or hit points equal to your healing surge value if you have no surges left). Otherwise, it lasts until you dismiss it as a minor action or until the end of the encounter.

Emerald Eye.name: Emerald Eye
Emerald Eye.flavor: A mote of green energy appears above you. A glaring, alien eye peers from it, giving you insight into your foe’s true nature.
Emerald Eye.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to Insight checks against the target and a +2 power bonus to attack rolls against the target’s Will.

Spectral Vision.name: Spectral Vision
Spectral Vision.flavor: Your surroundings shimmer and change. What was once a squalid cave is now an opulent throne room.
Spectral Vision.effect:
Until the end of the encounter, you mask the terrain around you, changing the appearance of all unattended objects and terrain features. The objects are still visible, but you disguise their true nature, making them look, smell, sound, and sometimes even feel like something else. For example, you could make a pool of lava look like a plush carpet, or make a pile of coins look and feel like mud. If an object is removed from the area, this effect ends for that object.
A creature can see through your deception by succeeding on an Insight check (DC 20 + one-half your level + your Intelligence modifier). A creature automatically sees through the illusion if it takes damage from a disguised object or disguised terrain (such as walking on an illusory carpet that is actually lava).

Summon Iron Cohort.name: Summon Iron Cohort
Summon Iron Cohort.flavor: A dwarf-sized humanoid creature of earth and iron ore appears near you. When you come under attack, it steps in to absorb the force of the blow.
Summon Iron Cohort.effect: You summon a Small iron cohort in an unoccupied square within the burst. The iron cohort has a speed of 6 and has a +2 bonus to AC. You can give the iron cohort the following special command.
Summon Iron Cohort.immediateInterrupt: When you are targeted by a ranged or melee attack and the iron cohort is adjacent to you, the iron cohort becomes the attack’s target instead.

Summon Diamond Falcon.name: Summon Diamond Falcon
Summon Diamond Falcon.flavor: A great bird of prey with gleaming white feathers appears from a planar portal and whisks you or an ally to safety.
Summon Diamond Falcon.effect: You summon a Medium diamond falcon in an unoccupied square within range. The falcon has a speed of fly 8 (hover). It has a +2 bonus to AC and a +2 bonus to Reflex. You can give the diamond falcon the following special command.
Summon Diamond Falcon.moveAction: The diamond falcon can carry you or one Medium or smaller ally that is adjacent to it when the falcon begins its move. The carried creature moves with the falcon and occupies its space; if the falcon provokes opportunity attacks, the attacker can target either the falcon or the carried creature. At the end of the falcon’s move, the carried creature can either remain in the falcon’s space (continuing to be carried) or land in a square adjacent to the falcon. A carried creature grants combat advantage and takes a –5 penalty to attack rolls.

Summon Hammerfist Crusher.name: Summon Hammerfist Crusher
Summon Hammerfist Crusher.flavor: A hulking creature of rock appears before you. It strikes too slowly to possibly hit a living creature, but its mighty fists turn walls and doors into rubble.
Summon Hammerfist Crusher.effect: You summon a Medium hammerfist crusher in an unoccupied square within range. The hammerfist crusher has a speed of 3. It has a +2 bonus to AC and a +2 bonus to Fortitude. You can give the crusher the following special command.
Summon Hammerfist Crusher.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one object; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 5d6 + Intelligence modifier damage.

Phantom Legion.name: Phantom Legion
Phantom Legion.flavor: A dozen illusory forms appear around you, creating a sprawling scene to deceive your enemies.
Phantom Legion.effect:
You create up to twelve Medium illusory creatures or objects, each of which appears in an unoccupied square within range. Each can make sounds and gestures but cannot voluntarily leave its space, and each of its defenses is 10. An illusory creature or object lasts until the end of the encounter, or until an attack hits it or a creature touches it.
As a move action, you can cause as many of the illusory creatures or objects as you wish to move up to 6 squares each. Each acts as an independent entity, saying whatever you wish and reacting as you choose to other creatures. However, you must have line of effect to an illusory creature or object to control it in this way. If you do not have line of effect, it does not move or respond.

Arcane Insight.name: Arcane Insight
Arcane Insight.flavor: You call upon the knowledge of your ancestors, summoning the collective arcane wisdom of millennia of eladrin history.
Arcane Insight.prerequisite: You must be trained in Arcana
Arcane Insight.trigger: You make an Arcana check and dislike the result.
Arcane Insight.effect: Reroll the Arcana check, keeping the better of the two results.

Feywild Spell Surge.name: Feywild Spell Surge
Feywild Spell Surge.flavor: You reach into the Feywild, drawing forth a torrent of the plane’s inherent arcane energy to fuel your spells.
Feywild Spell Surge.trigger: You miss with an arcane attack
Feywild Spell Surge.effect: Reroll the missed attack roll and use the second result.
Feywild Spell Surge.special: If you are an eladrin, you gain a +2 bonus to the reroll.

Shunt Between Worlds.name: Shunt Between Worlds
Shunt Between Worlds.flavor: You blast your foes with the same arcane energy you use to pass between worlds, shunting them into the Feywild and back again.
Shunt Between Worlds.target: All enemies within the area of the burst
Shunt Between Worlds.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and you teleport the target 5 squares. The destination must be on solid ground.

Phantom Bolt.name: Phantom Bolt
Phantom Bolt.flavor: You wave your hand, and your foe sees a bolt of fire streaking toward it. The enemy dives away from the imagined threat.
Phantom Bolt.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and you slide the target 1 square.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage.

Storm Pillar.name: Storm Pillar
Storm Pillar.flavor: A crackling column of lightning appears amid your enemies, lashing out at any who move near it.
Storm Pillar.effect:
You conjure a pillar of crackling energy in an unoccupied square within range. The pillar occupies 1 square and lasts until the end of your next turn. Each enemy that moves into a square adjacent to the pillar on its turn takes 1d6 + your Intelligence modifier lightning damage.
Level 21: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage.

Orbmaster's Incendiary Detonation.name: Orbmaster's Incendiary Detonation
Orbmaster's Incendiary Detonation.flavor: Gouts of flame pulse from your orb and explode amid your enemies, setting the area alight and roasting them as they attempt to escape.
keywords: Arcane, Evocation, Fire, Force, Implement, Zone
Orbmaster's Incendiary Detonation.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you knock the target prone.
Orbmaster's Incendiary Detonation.effect: The burst creates a zone of licking flames that lasts until the end of your next turn. Each enemy that enters the zone or starts its turn there takes 2 fire damage. An enemy can take this damage only once per turn.
Orbmaster's Incendiary Detonation.orbOfImposition: You can extend the duration of this effect, even though it is not an at-will power. If you do so, the area expands to burst 3 and doesn’t affect you or your allies.

Staffstrike Corrosion.name: Staffstrike Corrosion
Staffstrike Corrosion.flavor: You tap your staff on the ground, and acid boils up to envelop your target in a caustic haze.
Staffstrike Corrosion.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier acid damage. Until the end of your next turn, creatures more than 5 squares away from the target have concealment against it.
Staffstrike Corrosion.staffOfDefense: The next time you use the Staff of Defense class feature before the end of the encounter, the attacker also takes acid damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Empowering Lightning.name: Empowering Lightning
Empowering Lightning.flavor: Green and yellow lightning twines around your wand, then flashes toward your enemy and explodes in a shower of sparks.
Empowering Lightning.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and you push the target 1 square.
Empowering Lightning.wandOfAccuracy: The next time you use the Wand of Accuracy class feature before the end of the encounter, you also gain a bonus to that attack’s damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Horrid Whispers.name: Horrid Whispers
Horrid Whispers.flavor: Your enemies are seemingly beset by dreadful noises. Desperate to find the source, they are oblivious to the true threat posed by you and your allies.
Horrid Whispers.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is slowed and takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends both).
Horrid Whispers.onMiss: The target is slowed and takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Rolling Thunder.name: Rolling Thunder
Rolling Thunder.flavor: Elemental thunder creatures tumble through your foes and knock them about.
Rolling Thunder.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and you slide the primary target 3 squares.
Rolling Thunder.onMiss: Half damage, and you slide the primary target 1 square.
Rolling Thunder.effect: You conjure a thunderball in 1 square within each primary target’s space. Each thunderball lasts until the end of your next turn. Each thunderball can make a secondary attack.
Rolling Thunder.trigger: A creature moves out of the thunderball’s square.

Pinioning Vortex.name: Pinioning Vortex
Pinioning Vortex.flavor: A miniature tornado roars forth to batter your enemy and lift it into the air.
Pinioning Vortex.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you slide the target 10 feet (2 squares) vertically. The target remains aloft until the start of its next turn; while aloft, it is dazed and immobilized, and it grants combat advantage to you and your allies. At the start of its next turn, it lands on its feet in the space it formerly occupied or in the nearest unoccupied space of its choice.

Phantom Mask.name: Phantom Mask
Phantom Mask.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Phantom Mask.flavor: With a gesture, you enable you and your allies to take on a nearly impenetrable disguise.
Phantom Mask.target: You and each ally in the burst
Phantom Mask.effect: Until the end of the encounter, each target assumes the appearance of a humanoid creature of his or her size, even the appearance of a specific individual you have seen. You can choose a different disguise for each target. A creature can perceive a target’s true form by succeeding on an Insight check (DC 15 + one-half your level + your Intelligence modifier).
Phantom Mask.standardAction: You can modify this illusion to cause any number of the targets to assume the appearance of a different humanoid creature.

Tomebound Ooze.name: Tomebound Ooze
Tomebound Ooze.flavor: Your foe is engulfed by an acidic, jellylike mass that continues to eat at it when that foe tries to attack.
Tomebound Ooze.effect: You conjure an ooze that fills the target’s space. It lasts until the end of your next turn. If the target moves, the ooze moves with it while it remains within range.
Tomebound Ooze.onHit: 4d8 + Intelligence modifier acid damage. Until the end of your next turn, whenever the target makes an attack roll, it takes acid damage equal to your Constitution modifier.
Tomebound Ooze.tomeOfBinding: When the target first makes an attack roll before the end of your next turn, the ooze explodes. The explosion deals acid damage equal to your Constitution modifier to all enemies within 2 squares of the target, and the effect ends.

Face of Death.name: Face of Death
Face of Death.flavor: You create a vision of the reaper of souls before your foes’ eyes, and they freeze in terror of their impending death.

Orbmaster's Umbral Assault.name: Orbmaster's Umbral Assault
Orbmaster's Umbral Assault.flavor: A shroud of roiling shadows coalesces around your orb. Your enemies see a globe of utter blackness flare out to engulf them.
Orbmaster's Umbral Assault.effect: The burst creates a zone of illusory darkness that lasts until the end of your next turn. All creatures are blinded while they are within the zone.
Orbmaster's Umbral Assault.orbOfImposition: You can extend the duration of this effect, even though it is not an at-will power. If you do so, the zone expands to a burst 3 and doesn’t affect you or your allies.

Entangling Force.name: Entangling Force
Entangling Force.flavor: A burst of force erupts around your enemies, knocking them off balance and impeding their movement.
Entangling Force.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier force damage. Until the end of your next turn, the target is slowed and can’t teleport, and it provokes opportunity attacks when it shifts.
Entangling Force.wandOfAccuracy: On a miss, you deal force damage to the target equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Clever Escape.name: Clever Escape
Clever Escape.flavor: As your foes close in for the kill, you buy time for escape with a cunningly crafted duplicate of yourself.
Clever Escape.effect:
You become invisible and teleport 6 squares. You leave behind an illusory image of yourself in the space you occupied. The illusion stands in place, takes no actions, and uses your defenses if it is attacked. It lasts until the end of the encounter or until it is touched or hit by an attack. Your invisibility lasts until the end of your next turn or until you make an attack roll.
A creature can recognize the illusion by making a successful Insight check (DC 15 + one-half your level + your Intelligence modifier).

Dancing Bolts.name: Dancing Bolts
Dancing Bolts.flavor: Snapping blue arcs of lightning erupt from the ground, leaping from one foe to another.

bonusPower.name: Dancing Bolts Secondary Attack
bonusPower.flavor: Snapping blue arcs of lightning erupt from the ground, leaping from one foe to another.
bonusPower.requirement: You have hit an enemy with the Dancing Bolts power this round.
bonusPower.target: One enemy that has not yet been attacked by a Dancing Bolts attack and is within 2 squares of an enemy that has been hit by the Dancing Bolt power.
bonusPower.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and you slide the target 1 square.  If, after this movement, the target is within 2 squares of an enemy that has not yet been attacked by this use of this power, make a Dancing Bolts tertiary attack against that enemy using the secondary target as the origin square of the burst.

Dancing Bolts.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage, and you slide the target 1 square.  If, after this movement, the target is within 2 squares of an enemy that has not yet been attacked by this use of this power, make the following secondary attack against that enemy using the primary target as the origin square of the burst.

Oppressive Force.name: Oppressive Force
Oppressive Force.flavor: A massive barrage of arcane energy slams your foe to the ground and grinds it into the dirt.
Oppressive Force.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and the target is knocked prone and affected by oppressive force (save ends). While affected by oppressive force, the target takes ongoing 10 force damage and can’t stand up from prone.
Oppressive Force.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is knocked prone and affected by oppressive force (save ends). While affected by oppressive force, the target takes ongoing 5 force damage and can’t stand up from prone.

Astral Claw.name: Astral Claw
Astral Claw.flavor: For a moment, the borders between the worlds blur. The massive claw of an enormous beast reaches through the planes to crush your foe and hurl it to the ground.
Astral Claw.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you slide the target 5 squares and knock it prone.
Astral Claw.effect: You conjure an astral claw in 1 square of the target’s space after this attack is resolved. The claw lasts until the end of your next turn. If the target stands up while the astral claw is in its space, the target takes damage equal to your Constitution modifier.

Orbmaster's Insuperable Lethargy.name: Orbmaster's Insuperable Lethargy
Orbmaster's Insuperable Lethargy.flavor: A blood-red sphere of arcane power emanates from your orb to surround your foes, sinking into them and sapping their energy.
Orbmaster's Insuperable Lethargy.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is either weakened or immobilized (your choice) until the end of your next turn.
Orbmaster's Insuperable Lethargy.orbOfImposition: You can extend the duration of this power, even though it is not an at-will power. If you do so, each target is both weakened and immobilized until the end of your next turn.

Staffstrike Shock.name: Staffstrike Shock
Staffstrike Shock.flavor: You grip your staff as you shout a mystic phrase. The staff transforms into a crackling bolt of lightning that hurls you away from an attack.
Staffstrike Shock.staffOfDefense: The next time you use the Staff of Defense class feature before the end of the encounter, the enemy whose attack you interrupted also takes 10 lightning damage, and you teleport 5 squares as a free action.

Freezing Bolts.name: Freezing Bolts
Freezing Bolts.flavor: A thin layer of ice coats your wand, unleashing frigid waves as unstoppable as winter itself.
Freezing Bolts.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Freezing Bolts.wandOfAccuracy: Reroll any missed attack with this power.

Orbmaster's Prismatic Sphere.name: Orbmaster's Prismatic Sphere
Orbmaster's Prismatic Sphere.flavor: Your orb swirls with a rainbow of colors that flash out and cloak your foes in a scintillating globe.
Orbmaster's Prismatic Sphere.onHit (Fortitude): 3d6 + Intelligence modifier poison damage, and ongoing 10 poison damage (save ends).
Orbmaster's Prismatic Sphere.onHit (Reflex): 3d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends).
Orbmaster's Prismatic Sphere.special: You make one attack roll per target and compare that result against all three defenses. A target might be subject to any, all, or none of the consequences of a hit depending on how  many of its defenses were hit. The target must roll a saving throw against each condition or instance of ongoing damage separately.
Orbmaster's Prismatic Sphere.orbOfImposition: If you impose a penalty to saving throws against this power, the penalty applies to all targets instead of just one.

Tomebound Bloodbeast.name: Tomebound Bloodbeast
Tomebound Bloodbeast.flavor: From your tome springs a writhing, formless creature covered with long spikes that drinks your foes’ blood and transfers their vigor to you.
Tomebound Bloodbeast.effect:
You conjure a tomebound bloodbeast that occupies 1 square in range. It lasts until the end of your next turn.
Whenever a creature adjacent to the bloodbeast moves, that creature takes damage equal to your Constitution modifier, and you gain the same number of temporary hit points. These temporary hit points stack with each other and with temporary hit points from other sources.
Tomebound Bloodbeast.tomeOfBinding: If you increase the damage dealt by this power to a creature that moves, all allies within 5 squares of the bloodbeast also gain the temporary hit points.

Visions of Wrath.name: Visions of Wrath
Visions of Wrath.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Feywild
Visions of Wrath.flavor: At your command, your enemies fall upon each other with bloodcurdling cries.
Visions of Wrath.onHit: The target is dominated (save ends). If you or your allies attack the target, it gets a saving throw against this effect. If you do not compel the target to make any attack rolls during its turn, it automatically succeeds on its saving throw against this effect at the end of that turn. If you compel the target to make one or more attack rolls but it does not hit any targets, it automatically fails its next saving throw against this effect.
Visions of Wrath.onMiss: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Daunting Presence.name: Daunting Presence
Daunting Presence.flavor: Shadows deepen around you, your voice deepens to a rumble, and you appear to grow larger as you confront those foolish enough to dispute your wishes.
Daunting Presence.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to Intimidate checks, and creatures adjacent to you take a -2 penalty to attack rolls that target you.

Guardian Blades.name: Guardian Blades
Guardian Blades.flavor: Three spectral blades appear around you, floating in a ring that wards away your foes.
Guardian Blades.effect: Until the end of the encounter or until you become unconscious, each enemy adjacent to you that makes an attack roll takes force damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. No enemy can take this damage more than once per turn.

Wizard's Escape.name: Wizard's Escape
Wizard's Escape.sourceRef: Arcane Power, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Wizard's Escape.flavor: With a flash, you are gone.
Wizard's Escape.trigger: An enemy hits you with a melee attack.
Wizard's Escape.effect: You teleport up to 5 squares to a space that is not adjacent to an enemy.

Concussive Echo.name: Concussive Echo
Concussive Echo.flavor: A focused blast of thunder slams into your foe, and the energy of the blast is stored in your enemy’s body. When it next attacks, that energy is released in a concussive burst.
Concussive Echo.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage. The first time the target makes an attack roll before the end of your next turn, it deals 5 thunder damage to itself and to each enemy within 3 squares of it.

Illusory Assailant.name: Illusory Assailant
Illusory Assailant.flavor: You produce a lifelike illusion of a warrior that attacks your enemies and aids your allies.
Illusory Assailant.effect: You bring forth a Medium illusory warrior in an unoccupied square within range, and the warrior makes the following melee attack. Enemies cannot enter the illusory warrior’s space, but allies can, and the illusory warrior is considered an ally for the purpose of flanking. The illusory warrior lasts until the end of your next turn,
Illusory Assailant.target: One creature adjacent to the warrior

Mordenkainen's Lucubration.name: Mordenkainen's Lucubration
Mordenkainen's Lucubration.flavor: Your mastery of the arcane arts allows you to push your mind far beyond its limits, tapping into reserves of magic that allow your spells to endure.
Mordenkainen's Lucubration.effect: Until the end of the encounter or until you become unconscious, your arcane powers that can be sustained instead last until the end of the encounter.

Grasp of the Grave.name: Grasp of the Grave
Grasp of the Grave.flavor: Skeletal hands burst from the earth and ghostly claws swirl from the air to snatch at your foes.
Grasp of the Grave.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.
Grasp of the Grave.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. An enemy that enters the zone or that starts its turn in the zone takes 5 necrotic damage. An enemy can take this damage only once per turn.

Animate Dead.name: Animate Dead
Animate Dead.flavor: You flood a fallen foe’s animus with shadow, imbuing it with arcane strength.
Animate Dead.effect: You summon the animated corpse of one of your fallen enemies in an unoccupied square within range. The summoned creature is the same size as one dead creature within the range of this power. The animated creature has reach equal to the target creature’s reach and speed 6. It has a +2 bonus to AC and a +2 bonus to Fortitude. You can give the animated creature the following special commands.
Animate Dead.standardAction: Targets one enemy in reach; Intelligence vs. AC; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage.
Animate Dead.opportunityAttack: Targets one enemy in reach; Intelligence vs. AC; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage.

Soul Puppets.name: Soul Puppets
Soul Puppets.flavor: You reach out and crush your foes’ animating spirits, manipulating their limbs like a puppeteer.
keywords: Arcane, Charm, Implement, Necromancy, Necrotic, Shadow
Soul Puppets.onHit: 4d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends). If the target is undead, it takes no damage, and it is dominated instead of immobilized (save ends).

Entombing Earth.name: Entombing Earth
Entombing Earth.flavor: A maw of moaning grave dirt appears around your foe and slams shut with echoing finality.
Entombing Earth.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target takes ongoing 10 necrotic damage and is stunned (save ends both). Other creatures cannot gain line of sight or line of effect to the target while it is stunned.
Entombing Earth.onMiss: Half damage, and the target takes ongoing 10 necrotic damage (save ends).

Refocus.name: Refocus
Refocus.flavor: You take a deep breath and picture the pages of your spellbook in your mind.
Refocus.effect: You can replace an unexpended wizard utility or daily power with another power of the same level that is in your spellbook. You gain a +1 power bonus to attack rolls with that power until the end of your next turn.

Repelling Shield.name: Repelling Shield
Repelling Shield.flavor: A sudden shield of arcane energy blocks an attack and pushes the enemy away.
Repelling Shield.trigger: You are hit by a melee attack
Repelling Shield.effect: You gain a +4 power bonus to AC and Reflex until the end of your next turn. If any creature makes a melee attack against you while this effect lasts, you can push it 1 square after the attack resolves.

Chilling Cloud.name: Chilling Cloud
Chilling Cloud.flavor: A lingering swarm of ice crystals chills foes to the bone.
Chilling Cloud.effect: Until the end of your next turn, any enemy in the power’s area takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls. Increase damage to twice Intelligence modifier at 21st level.

Wizard's Fury.name: Wizard's Fury
Wizard's Fury.flavor: You begin to fling force bolts with a flick of your wrist.
Wizard's Fury.prerequisite: You must know the magic missile at-will wizard power.
Wizard's Fury.effect: Until the end of the encounter, as a minor action once per turn, you can cast magic missile.

Thunder Cage.name: Thunder Cage
Thunder Cage.flavor: Your foe is rocked by thunderous noise, and an ominous rumble begins at your enemy’s slightest move.
Thunder Cage.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage. If the target leaves the space it currently occupies before the start of your next turn, it takes an extra 1d10 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage.

Spatial Lock.name: Spatial Lock
Spatial Lock.flavor: A silver light flashes and an unseen pulse ripples through the air. Your foes aren’t going anywhere.
Spatial Lock.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Enemies within the zone cannot teleport, use teleportation powers, or benefit from phasing. Further, within the zone, magic portals fail to function and creatures cannot access other planes or extradimensional spaces.

Nightmare Eruption.name: Nightmare Eruption
Nightmare Eruption.flavor: You bring forth a nightmare in your foe’s mind and project it out for its comrades to see.
Nightmare Eruption.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and any enemy adjacent to the target takes psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage.

Radiant Pillar.name: Radiant Pillar
Radiant Pillar.flavor: You conjure a cylinder of light that illuminates the battlefield, searing the eyes of your foes.
Radiant Pillar.effect: The burst creates a zone of bright light until the end of your next turn. Creatures are blinded while within the zone. If a creature vulnerable to radiant damage starts its turn within the zone, it takes damage equal to double its vulnerability.

Thunderstaff.name: Thunderstaff
Thunderstaff.flavor: As your enemy comes too close, you slam the butt of your staff into the ground, sending a shockwave that knocks it off its feet and far away from you.
Thunderstaff.requirement: You must be wielding a staff.
Thunderstaff.trigger: An enemy moves to within 2 squares of you.
Thunderstaff.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier, and the target is deafened and dazed until the end of your next turn.
Thunderstaff.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is deafened until the end of your next turn.

Able Companion.name: Able Companion
Able Companion.flavor: You conjure a creature of many hands and feet that aids your allies.
Able Companion.effect: You conjure an able companion in an unoccupied square within range until the end of the encounter. When an ally starts its turn adjacent to the companion, that ally can stand or shift 1 square as a free action. You can move the companion 2 squares as a minor action or 6 squares as a move action.

Tome of Transposition.name: Tome of Transposition
Tome of Transposition.flavor: You open your tome to a page of secrets and flood your foe’s mind with them, causing its weak brain to overload.
Tome of Transposition.requirement: You must be wielding a tome.
Tome of Transposition.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Tome of Transposition.onMiss: Choose another ranged daily spell of equal or lower level to this power from your spellbook. Immediately cast that spell. It must target your original target and it deals half damage.

Dimension Switch.name: Dimension Switch
Dimension Switch.sourceRef: Dragon Magazine 380, Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Dimension Switch.flavor: You and your ally teleport into each other’s locations.
Dimension Switch.target: You and one ally in the burst

Wand Coupling.name: Wand Coupling
Wand Coupling.flavor: You release a blast of energy from your wand, and as that energy flows outward, it pulses briefly and brightly with a secondary surge of magic.
Wand Coupling.requirement: You must be wielding a wand.
Wand Coupling.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you push the target 3 squares. If your wand has an unexpended magic item encounter power, you can use that power as a free action.

Summon Angel Wretch.name: Summon Angel Wretch
Summon Angel Wretch.flavor: A spectral creature composed of numerous wispy black-feathered wings, all joined together at the pinions, attacks with gouts of shadowy noxious gas.
Summon Angel Wretch.effect: You summon a Large angel wretch in an unoccupied space within range. The angel wretch has a fly speed of 8. It has a +4 bonus to AC and a +4 bonus to Fortitude. You can give the angel wretch the following special commands.
Summon Angel Wretch.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage.
Summon Angel Wretch.opportunityAttack: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage.

Dimensional Journey.name: Dimensional Journey
Dimensional Journey.flavor: You take a step and reappear well away from your starting point.
Dimensional Journey.effect: You teleport 20 squares. You do not need line of sight to your destination.

Orb of Doom.name: Orb of Doom
Orb of Doom.flavor: You create a replica of your orb around your foes, trapping them in a crystalline prison.
Orb of Doom.requirement: You must be wielding an orb.
Orb of Doom.onHit: Until the end of your next turn, the target is restrained, cannot teleport, and takes a –5 penalty to attack rolls against creatures outside the area of the burst.

Winged Horde.name: Winged Horde
Winged Horde.sourceRef: Dragon Magazine 381, Heroes of the Feywild
Winged Horde.flavor: A horde of flesh-devouring sprites appears in your foes’ minds. The enemies shriek in horror and swat at the menace, leaving them unable to react to your allies’ maneuvers.
Winged Horde.onHit:
1d6 psychic damage, and the target cannot take opportunity actions until the end of your next turn.
Level 21: 2d6 psychic damage.

Charm of Misplaced Wrath.name: Charm of Misplaced Wrath
Charm of Misplaced Wrath.sourceRef: Dragon Magazine 381, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Charm of Misplaced Wrath.flavor: You bend your foe’s mind, filling it with wrath even as you twist its senses.
Charm of Misplaced Wrath.onHit: You slide the target up to 3 squares. The target is then dazed until the end of your next turn.
Charm of Misplaced Wrath.effect: The target makes a basic attack against a creature of your choice as a free action. The basic attack gains a +2 power bonus to the damage roll.

Glib Tongue.name: Glib Tongue
Glib Tongue.flavor: You weave magic into your words, defusing a dangerous situation through the fine art of diplomacy.
Glib Tongue.effect: You gain a +5 power bonus to Diplomacy checks and a +2 power bonus to charm attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Memory to Mist.name: Memory to Mist
Memory to Mist.flavor: Your magic settles into a creature’s mind, causing it to forget what it just witnessed.
Memory to Mist.target: One creature that is not involved in combat and that is lower level than you
Memory to Mist.effect: The creature forgets everything that happened in the past 10 minutes and for the next 1 minute.

Spectral Image.name: Spectral Image
Spectral Image.sourceRef: Dragon Magazine 381, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Spectral Image.flavor: You make a complex illusion of a creature or an object to fool your enemies.
Spectral Image.effect:
The illusion of a creature or an object up to Medium size appears in an unoccupied square within range. It can make sounds and can move within its square, but it cannot leave it. Each of its defenses is 10. The illusion lasts until the end of the encounter, until an attack hits it, or until a creature touches it or moves through it.
An Insight check (DC 15 + one-half your level + your Intelligence modifier) allows a creature to determine that the image is an illusion.

Arcane Bolt.name: Arcane Bolt
Arcane Bolt.flavor: A silver arrow of force appears next to you. You gesture toward a foe, sending the arrow on an unerring path toward that enemy.
Arcane Bolt.effect: The target takes force damage equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier + the enhancement bonus of your implement.

Glowering Wrath.name: Glowering Wrath
Glowering Wrath.flavor: You voice thunders above the din of the battlefield, casting fear and doubt into your foes.
Glowering Wrath.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to Intimidate checks and increase the distance of any forced movement you cause by 2 squares.

Charm of the Defender.name: Charm of the Defender
Charm of the Defender.sourceRef: Dragon Magazine 381, Heroes of the Fallen Lands
Charm of the Defender.flavor: You weave a skein of deceitful magic, tricking your foe to become a hero to its enemies.
Charm of the Defender.onHit: You slide the target up to 3 squares, and it is immobilized until the end of your next turn. Also until the end of your next turn, when an enemy starts its turn adjacent to the target, the target makes a melee basic attack against that enemy as a free action. The target gains a power bonus to the attack roll and the damage roll equal to your implement’s enhancement bonus.
Charm of the Defender.onMiss: You slide the target up to 3 squares.

Words of Deceit.name: Words of Deceit
Words of Deceit.flavor: Your words move in a spiral, folding into themselves to deceive your enemies. You weave a magical attack into them that remains in your grasp should your foe’s mind prove too strong to overcome.
Words of Deceit.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to Bluff checks and you retain the use of any single-target, encounter charm spells that miss.

Arcane Arrows.name: Arcane Arrows
Arcane Arrows.flavor: You create a pair of arcane darts and send them speeding toward your enemy. No amount of armor or arcane defenses can protect it.
Arcane Arrows.target: One creature, or two creatures that are adjacent to each other
Arcane Arrows.effect: Each target takes force damage equal to 10 + your Intelligence modifier + your implement’s enhancement bonus.

Words of Truth.name: Words of Truth
Words of Truth.flavor: Arcane magic infuses your demands, forcing the creature that cowers before you to answer them without hesitation.
Words of Truth.target: One creature that is not involved in combat and that is lower level than you
Words of Truth.effect: You ask the creature one question, and it must answer truthfully.

Charm of False Glory.name: Charm of False Glory
Charm of False Glory.flavor: Your foe shouts in triumph as it suddenly turns against its allies. Your magic twists its sight and mind, causing it to see enemies where allies stand.
Charm of False Glory.onHit: Slide the target a number of squares equal to its speed. It is immobilized until the end of your next turn. In addition, until the end of your next turn, whenever an enemy starts its turn next to or moves to a square adjacent to the target, the target must make a melee basic attack as a free action against that enemy. The target gains a bonus to the attack roll and damage roll equal to your implement’s enhancement bonus. Each time it hits with this attack, you can slide the target 2 squares.

Arcane Volley.name: Arcane Volley
Arcane Volley.flavor: You launch a fusillade of arcane darts and send them speeding toward your enemies. No amount of armor or arcane defenses can protect your foes.
Arcane Volley.target: One creature, or two or three creatures that are adjacent to at least one other target.
Arcane Volley.effect: Each target takes force damage equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier + your implement’s enhancement bonus. If you have selected only two targets, increase the damage each target takes by 5. If you have selected only one target, instead increase the damage it takes by 10.

Charm of Puppet Strings.name: Charm of Puppet Strings
Charm of Puppet Strings.flavor: As your magic clouds your foe’s mind, it shrieks in fury and leaps from one of its allies to the next, hewing at them with a madman’s fury.
Charm of Puppet Strings.onHit: The target is dominated until the end of your next turn. In addition, at the start of the target’s next turn, you can slide it its speed. Until the end of your next turn, whenever an enemy starts its turn next to or moves to a square adjacent to the target, the target must make a melee basic attack as a free action against that enemy. The target gains a bonus to the attack roll and damage roll equal to your implement’s enhancement bonus.

Moonstride.name: Moonstride
Moonstride.flavor: This trick of the Maiden of the Moon allows you to take a form of pure moonlight and to evade your enemies with ease.
Moonstride.trigger: An enemy moves adjacent to you
Moonstride.effect: You become insubstantial until the end of your next turn. Then you shift 2 squares to a square farther from the triggering enemy.

Witch's Reversal.name: Witch's Reversal
Witch's Reversal.flavor: You look at the world with the eyes of the Witch of Fates, then pull the strands that allow you to steal victory from defeat.
Witch's Reversal.trigger: You use an arcane attack power and miss with at least two of that power’s attack rolls
Witch's Reversal.effect: You reroll the attack rolls that missed their targets and use the new results.

Conduit of Ice.name: Conduit of Ice
Conduit of Ice.flavor: You turn your enemy into a conduit to an ice storm from the Elemental Chaos.
Conduit of Ice.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and you create a zone of sudden cold in a burst 2 centered on the target until the end of your next turn. The zone moves with the target. The zone is difficult terrain, and any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes 5 cold damage.
Conduit of Ice.activeFamiliar: While your familiar is in the zone, it knocks prone any enemy that ends its turn in the zone.

Familiar Harrier.name: Familiar Harrier
Familiar Harrier.flavor: You send your familiar in to keep your opponent off balance.
Familiar Harrier.effect: Teleport your familiar 10 squares, and until the end of your next turn your familiar can flank with you or your allies. When an attack hits a creature flanked by the familiar, that creature cannot shift until the end of its next turn.

Melting Pool.name: Melting Pool
Melting Pool.flavor: You create an extradimensional pool of acid beneath your enemies’ feet.
Melting Pool.activeFamiliar: Any enemy hit by this attack must spend an extra square of movement to leave its square while within 3 squares of your familiar until the end of your next turn.

Familiar's Call.name: Familiar's Call
Familiar's Call.flavor: You teleport yourself to where your familiar is.
Familiar's Call.effect: You teleport up to 20 squares to the square occupied by your familiar and your familiar enters passive mode.

Repelling Sphere.name: Repelling Sphere
Repelling Sphere.flavor: You repulse your enemies with an expending sphere of force.
Repelling Sphere.activeFamiliar: You can center this burst on your familiar instead of on you.
Repelling Sphere.onHit: 2d4 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you push the target to a space outside the burst.

Circle of Protection.name: Circle of Protection
Circle of Protection.flavor: You weave a circle of protective runes that guard your allies and can draw power from your familiar for greater strength.
Circle of Protection.effect: The burst becomes a zone of protection until the end of your next turn. You and allies gain resist to all damage equal to your Intelligence modifier while in the zone. Enemies must spend 2 extra squares of movement to enter the zone. You make an attack.
Circle of Protection.arcaneFamiliar: Add a +4 power bonus to the attack roll if your familiar is in the burst.
Circle of Protection.onHit: Push the target from the burst’s origin square to a space outside the zone. You cannot push the target when doing so causes the target to take damage or make a saving throw.

Arcane Chastisement.name: Arcane Chastisement
Arcane Chastisement.flavor: Your retributive strike more than teaches the enemy not to harm you, it compels it.
Arcane Chastisement.trigger: An enemy hits you or an ally
Arcane Chastisement.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target cannot attack the creature it targeted with the triggering attack until the end of your next turn.
Arcane Chastisement.activeFamiliar: Until the end of your next turn, the target cannot attack your familiar and takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against creatures adjacent to your familiar.

Familiar Shape.name: Familiar Shape
Familiar Shape.flavor: You assume the shape of a creature that resembles your familiar.
Familiar Shape.effect: You assume a form identical to your familiar until the end of the encounter and, for the same duration, can change back or forth between this and your natural form as a minor action. In this form, you gain the movement modes, speed, and special senses of your familiar but cannot make attacks.

Thunderous Transformation.name: Thunderous Transformation
Thunderous Transformation.flavor: You translate your enemy’s physical form into a monstrous peal of thunder before it reincorporates nearby.
Thunderous Transformation.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and any creature within 2 squares of the target takes 10 thunder damage and falls prone. Then you teleport the target 5 squares.
Thunderous Transformation.activeFamiliar: You can teleport the target up to 20 squares to a space within 3 squares of your familiar.

Dire Familiar Incantation.name: Dire Familiar Incantation
Dire Familiar Incantation.flavor: Your familiar expands in size rapidly, becoming a threat to your enemies.
Dire Familiar Incantation.requirement: Your familiar must be in a square it could occupy as a Medium creature.
Dire Familiar Incantation.effect: Until the end of the encounter, your familiar becomes a Medium creature, gains a hit point total equal to your bloodied value, and can flank with you or your allies. While in this form, when any enemy adjacent to the familiar is hit by an attack, you may uses a free action to have the familiar knocks that enemy prone, push it 1 square, or shifts 1 square and slides that enemy into the square the familiar left.

Crushing Necrotism.name: Crushing Necrotism
Crushing Necrotism.flavor: You encase your foe in tightening necrotic energy, which washes over its allies when the enemy struggles free.
Crushing Necrotism.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is slowed and grants combat advantage until the end of the target’s next turn. At the end of the target’s next turn, any enemy within 2 squares of the target takes 10 necrotic damage and you push that enemy 2 squares from the target.
Crushing Necrotism.activeFamiliar: At the end of the target’s next turn, you also push any enemy within 2 squares of your familiar 2 squares from your familiar.

Mind-Numbing Presence.name: Mind-Numbing Presence
Mind-Numbing Presence.flavor: You surround your foe with a field that dampens thought.
Mind-Numbing Presence.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and a burst 3 centered on the target becomes a zone of numbed thought until the end of your next turn. This zone moves with the target. Any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes 10 psychic damage, and any enemy that enters or leaves the zone becomes dazed until the end of your next turn.
Mind-Numbing Presence.activeFamiliar: When an enemy takes damage from the zone or becomes dazed by the zone, your familiar can shift 3 squares as a free action.

Skewering Spikes.name: Skewering Spikes
Skewering Spikes.flavor: You call forth floating spikes of metal and stone that rapidly streak toward your foes.
Skewering Spikes.onHit: 1d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, or 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage if you target only one creature.

Arcane Whirlwind.name: Arcane Whirlwind
Arcane Whirlwind.flavor: Howling winds straight from the Elemental Chaos whip your foes around the battlefield.
Arcane Whirlwind.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage, and you slide the target 1 square.
Arcane Whirlwind.effect: The burst creates a zone of rushing winds that lasts until the end of your next turn. As a minor action, you can slide one creature within the zone 2 squares. As a move action, you can move the zone 6 squares.
Arcane Whirlwind.sustainMinor: The zone persists, and you can slide one creature within the zone 2 squares.

Mystical Debris.name: Mystical Debris
Mystical Debris.flavor: You create a small amount of stone and rubble that clogs up the area.
Mystical Debris.effect: One square in range becomes difficult terrain until the end of the encounter. You can end this effect as a minor action.
Mystical Debris.special: You cannot have more squares than your Intelligence modifier under this effect at one time.

Cinderfall.name: Cinderfall
Cinderfall.flavor: A thousand motes of fire momentarily linger in the air in front of you before streaking toward a single foe.
Cinderfall.effect: You deal 5 fire damage to one target in the burst.

Scattering Shock.name: Scattering Shock
Scattering Shock.flavor: Mystical forces draw your foes together as they are struck by a blast of lightning.
Scattering Shock.secondaryTarget: One enemy in the burst and each creature adjacent to that enemy

Force Ladder.name: Force Ladder
Force Ladder.flavor: You create a shimmering ladder to aid your ascent.
Force Ladder.effect: You conjure a ladder of arcane force in an unoccupied square within range. The ladder can be up to 8 squares tall and lasts until the end of the encounter. The ladder stands firmly, does not need to be attached to anything, and cannot be moved unless you permit it. Climbing the ladder requires a DC 10 Athletics check.

Corrosive Mist.name: Corrosive Mist
Corrosive Mist.flavor: A mist of suspended acid droplets consumes your chosen foes.
Corrosive Mist.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier acid damage, or 3d8 + Intelligence modifier acid damage if there is only one target.
Corrosive Mist.effect: The burst creates a zone of floating droplets of acid that lasts until the end of your next turn. Each creature that enters the zone or starts its turn in the zone takes acid damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Firescythe.name: Firescythe
Firescythe.flavor: Your allies have the split second warning necessary to duck beneath the enormous, flaming scythe summoned by your magic.
Firescythe.effect: Each ally in the area can fall prone as a free action.
Firescythe.target: Each nonprone creature in the burst

Summon Dretch.name: Summon Dretch
Summon Dretch.flavor: A nauseating stench and puff of brimstone herald the arrival of a loathsome, drooling dretch.
Summon Dretch.effect: You summon a Small dretch in an unoccupied space within range. The dretch has speed 5. If the dretch is reduced to 0 hit points, creatures adjacent to it take 5 poison damage. You can give the dretch the following special command.
Summon Dretch.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one or two creatures; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d6 + Intelligence modifier damage.
Summon Dretch.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the dretch any commands by the end of your turn, it attacks or charges the nearest creature and makes its listed attack (above) in place of a melee basic attack. If it cannot attack or charge, it moves 5 squares toward the nearest creature. In addition, you take 1d6 damage each time you take a standard or move action before the end of your next turn.
Summon Dretch.symbiosis: While the summoned dretch is present, each creature you hit with a basic or at-will attack takes 5 damage if it makes an attack before the end of its next turn, after it makes the attack.

Summon Dust Devil.name: Summon Dust Devil
Summon Dust Devil.flavor: Loose objects skitter about as the air whips round, coalescing into a whirling elemental.
Summon Dust Devil.effect: You summon a Small dust devil in an unoccupied space within range. The dust devil has speed 8. You can give the dust devil the following special command.
Summon Dust Devil.standardAction: Close burst 1; targets each creature in the burst; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the dust devil slides the target 2 squares.
Summon Dust Devil.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the dust devil any commands by the end of your turn, it attacks an adjacent creature. If it can’t do that, it moves its speed toward the nearest creature. In addition, you fall prone.
Summon Dust Devil.symbiosis: While the summoned dust devil is present, you gain a +2 power bonus to speed and a +4 power bonus to all defenses against opportunity attacks.

Summon Imp.name: Summon Imp
Summon Imp.flavor: With a crack and a flash of blood-red light, a tiny winged devil appears, scorpionlike tail held ready.
Summon Imp.effect: You summon a Small imp in an unoccupied space within range. The imp has speed 4, fly 6 (hover), and resist 5 fire. You can give the imp the following special command.
Summon Imp.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and ongoing 5 poison damage (save ends). The imp becomes invisible until the start of your next turn.
Summon Imp.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the imp any commands by the end of your turn, it attacks an adjacent enemy that grants it combat advantage. If it can’t do that, it turns invisible and moves its speed to a square adjacent to an enemy. In addition, you grant combat advantage to all enemies until the end of your next turn.
Summon Imp.symbiosis: While the summoned imp is present, you deal 1d6 extra poison damage with attacks when your target grants you combat advantage.

Summon Magma Beast.name: Summon Magma Beast
Summon Magma Beast.flavor: Erupting into being with a blast of searing heat comes a magma beast, eager to incinerate your foes.
Summon Magma Beast.effect: You summon a Medium magma beast in an unoccupied space within range. The magma beast has speed 4 (8 while charging) and resist 5 fire. You can give the magma beast the following special command.
Summon Magma Beast.standardAction: Melee 1; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and the target takes ongoing 5 fire damage and is slowed (save ends both).
Summon Magma Beast.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the magma beast any commands by the end of your turn, it attacks an adjacent creature or charges the nearest creature it can charge and makes its listed attack (above) in place of a melee basic attack. Otherwise, it moves its speed toward the nearest enemy. In addition, you are slowed until the end of your next turn.
Summon Magma Beast.symbiosis: While the summoned magma beast is present, you can shift 2 squares with a move action. Each creature that you hit with a basic or at-will attack cannot shift until the end of its next turn.

Summon Hell Hound.name: Summon Hell Hound
Summon Hell Hound.flavor: You summon a burning, houndlike creature that bays with the voice of a raging inferno.
Summon Hell Hound.effect: You summon a Medium hell hound in an unoccupied space within range. The hell hound has speed 7 and resist 10 fire. Any creature that enters a square adjacent to it or starts its turn there takes 5 fire damage. You can give the hell hound the following special command.
Summon Hell Hound.standardAction: Close blast 3; targets each creature in the blast; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.
Summon Hell Hound.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the hell hound any commands by the end of your turn, it makes its attack against at least one enemy, targeting as many creatures as possible. If it can’t target any enemies, it moves its speed toward the nearest enemy. In addition, you take 5 fire damage.
Summon Hell Hound.symbiosis: While the summoned hell hound is present, you deal 1d6 extra fire damage with close and area attacks, and each creature that hits you with melee attacks takes 1d6 fire damage.

Summon Succubus.name: Summon Succubus
Summon Succubus.flavor: With a puff of perfumed brimstone, a succubus saunters into the world at your call.
Summon Succubus.effect: You summon a Medium succubus in an unoccupied space within range. The succubus has speed 6, fly 6, and resist 10 fire. You can give the succubus the following special command.
Summon Succubus.standardAction: Ranged 5; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Will; 1d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is dominated until the end of your next turn. Once a creature has been dominated, the target cannot be dominated by the succubus again this encounter.
Summon Succubus.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the succubus any commands by the end of your turn, it shifts 1 square and attacks the nearest enemy within range that is not dominated. In addition, you are dazed until the end of your next turn.
Summon Succubus.symbiosis: While the summoned succubus is present, each creature you hit with a basic or at-will attack takes a -4 penalty to attacks rolls made against you until the end of its next turn.

Summon Stormstone Fury.name: Summon Stormstone Fury
Summon Stormstone Fury.flavor: A hulking elemental of stone and living thunder answers your summons with a sound akin to cracking rock and rumbling thunder.
Summon Stormstone Fury.effect: You summon a Medium stormstone fury in an unoccupied space within range. The stormstone fury has speed 6 and resist 10 thunder. You can give the stormstone fury the following special commands.
Summon Stormstone Fury.standardAction: Area burst 2 within 10; targets each creature in the burst; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 1d12 + Intelligence modifier thunder damage. A target in the origin square of the burst takes 2d8 extra damage if hit.
Summon Stormstone Fury.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the stormstone fury any commands by the end of your turn, it makes its attack targeting as many creatures as possible. In addition, you take 5 thunder damage and fall prone.
Summon Stormstone Fury.symbiosis: While the summoned stormstone fury is present, you deal 2d6 extra thunder damage with area attacks, and each creature in the origin square of your area attacks takes 2d6 thunder damage if you miss.

Summon Vrock.name: Summon Vrock
Summon Vrock.flavor: A foul smelling, feathered demon screeches into being, wicked talons flexing in anticipation of tearing flesh.
Summon Vrock.effect: You summon a Large vrock in an unoccupied space within range. The vrock has speed 6 and fly 8. You can give the vrock the following special command.
Summon Vrock.standardAction: The vrock moves its fly speed and makes the following attack at one point during the movement; melee 2; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d10 + Intelligence modifier damage. The vrock does not provoke opportunity attacks for this movement from the target of its attack.
Summon Vrock.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the vrock any commands by the end of your turn, it makes its attack against the nearest creature. If it can’t reach any targets, it moves its speed toward the nearest creature. In addition, you take10 poison damage and you lose your minor action on your next turn.
Summon Vrock.symbiosis: While the summoned vrock is present, you do not provoke opportunity attacks for moving through threatened squares, and you deal 2d6 extra poison damage with attacks that stun or daze targets.

Summon Couatl.name: Summon Couatl
Summon Couatl.flavor: An ancient incantation summons a benevolent, winged, snakelike couatl to your aid.
Summon Couatl.effect: You summon a Large couatl in an unoccupied space within range. The couatl has speed 6, fly 8 (hover), and is immune to being immobilized or restrained. You can give the couatl the following special command.
Summon Couatl.standardAction: Ranged 20; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d10 + Intelligence modifier lightning and radiant damage, or 3d10 + Intelligence modifier lightning and radiant damage against demons.
Summon Couatl.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the couatl any commands by the end of your turn, it shifts 1 square and attacks the nearest creature within range. In addition, you take 10 radiant damage and the couatl pushes you 2 squares.
Summon Couatl.symbiosis: While the summoned couatl is present, if you take radiant damage from a creature other than the couatl you summoned, your attacks deal 2d6 extra radiant damage until the end of your next turn. Additionally, you make saving throws against immobilized and restrained conditions at the start of your turn as well as at the end of your turn.

Summon Rockfire Dreadnought.name: Summon Rockfire Dreadnought
Summon Rockfire Dreadnought.flavor: You summon a durable elemental minion from a fiery region of the Elemental Chaos.
Summon Rockfire Dreadnought.effect: You summon a Large rockfire dreadnought in an unoccupied space within range. The rockfire dreadnought has speed 8, a +2 bonus to AC, and resist 10 fire. Any creature that enters a square adjacent to it or starts its turn there takes 10 fire damage. You can give the rockfire dreadnought the following special command.
Summon Rockfire Dreadnought.standardAction: Melee 2; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d10 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.
Summon Rockfire Dreadnought.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the rockfire dreadnought any commands by the end of your turn, it attacks the nearest enemy within its reach. If no enemies are within its reach, it attacks the nearest creature within reach of it. Otherwise it moves its speed toward the nearest enemy. In addition, you take 10 fire damage and take a -2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn.
Summon Rockfire Dreadnought.symbiosis: While the summoned rockfire dreadnought is present, you gain a +2 power bonus to AC and each creature that hits you with a melee attack takes 5 fire damage.

Summon Earthwind Ravager.name: Summon Earthwind Ravager
Summon Earthwind Ravager.flavor: Punishing winds blast outward as a churning creature of stone and whipping air bursts into being.
Summon Earthwind Ravager.effect: You summon a Large earthwind ravager in an unoccupied space within range. The ravager has fly 8 (hover). You can give the earthwind ravager the following special command.
Summon Earthwind Ravager.standardAction: Ranged 5; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Fortitude; 3d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of the earthwind ravager’s next turn.
Summon Earthwind Ravager.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the earthwind ravager any commands by the end of your turn, it shifts 1 square and attacks the creature it attacked last. If it can’t attack the creature it attacked last, it attacks the nearest creature within range. In addition, you take 10 damage and you are immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Summon Earthwind Ravager.symbiosis: While the summoned earthwind ravager is present, when you hit a target with a basic or at-will attack, you push the target 2 squares. Additionally, each enemy that starts its turn immobilized, restrained, or slowed by you takes 2d8 damage.

Summon Marilith.name: Summon Marilith
Summon Marilith.flavor: Bleeding gashes in the air appear as a many-armed demon slashes its way into reality at your summons.
Summon Marilith.effect: You summon a Large marilith in an unoccupied space within range. The marilith has speed 8. You can give the marilith the following special command.
Summon Marilith.standardAction: The marilith makes three of the following attacks: Melee 2; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 2d10 + Intelligence modifier damage (3d10 + Intelligence modifier damage against bloodied creatures), and the marilith shifts 2 squares.
Summon Marilith.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the marilith any commands by the end of your turn, it attacks the nearest enemy within its reach, or the nearest creature within its reach if no enemies are within its reach. If no enemies are within its reach, it moves its speed toward the nearest enemy. In addition, you take15 damage (20 if you are bloodied).
Summon Marilith.symbiosis: While the summoned marilith is present, you can shift 1 square whenever you hit with a basic or at-will attack. Additionally, when an adjacent enemy misses you with a melee attack, you can make a basic or at-will attack that includes that enemy as a target as an opportunity action. This attack does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Summon Balor.name: Summon Balor
Summon Balor.flavor: The very air screams as if in pain and the ground cracks and blackens as reality struggles against the emergence of the terrible fiend called forth by your magic.
Summon Balor.effect: You summon a Huge balor in an unoccupied space within range. The balor has a speed of 8, a fly speed of 12 (clumsy), resist 25 fire, and creatures that start their turns within 2 squares of the balor take 10 fire damage. You can give the balor the following special command.
Summon Balor.standardAction: Melee 5; targets one creature; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 4d10 + Intelligence modifier fire and lightning damage, and the balor slides the target 5 squares into an unoccupied space adjacent to the balor.
Summon Balor.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the balor any commands by the end of your turn, it attacks the nearest creature within its reach. If there are no creatures within its reach it moves its speed toward the nearest enemy. Additionally, if you are within its reach, the balor makes its melee attack against you.
Summon Balor.symbiosis: While the summoned balor is present, each creature that hits you with melee attacks take 10 fire damage, and you deal 15 extra fire and lightning damage with basic, at-will, and encounter powers.

Summon Djinn Stormcaller.name: Summon Djinn Stormcaller
Summon Djinn Stormcaller.flavor: A peal of thunder sounds as a whirling storm cloud explodes into being, a resplendent, pale-skinned humanoid visible within it.
Summon Djinn Stormcaller.effect: You summon a Large djinn in an unoccupied space within range. The djinn has speed 6, fly 8 (hover), and resist 15 thunder. You can give the djinn the following special command.
Summon Djinn Stormcaller.standardAction: Close burst 2; targets creatures in the burst; Intelligence vs. Reflex; 3d10 + Intelligence modifier lightning and thunder damage. Effect: The djinn slides the target 3 squares.
Summon Djinn Stormcaller.intrinsicNature: If you haven’t given the djinn any commands by the end of your turn, it shifts its speed and makes its attack, trying to catch as many creatures in the burst as possible. In addition, you take 10 thunder damage, fall prone, and are restrained until the end of your next turn.
Summon Djinn Stormcaller.symbiosis: While the summoned djinn stormcaller is present, gain fly speed 8 (hover), and you can teleport 3 squares either before or after you make a basic or at-will attack as a free action. Powers you use that push or pull targets instead slide them an equal number of squares.

Erupting Flare.name: Erupting Flare
Erupting Flare.flavor: You kindle a massive, sudden flame within your enemy. The fires burn your foe and spill out to singe any who stay near it.
Erupting Flare.onHit:
1d10 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and any creature that ends its turn adjacent to the target before the end of the target’s next turn takes fire damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.

Fire Sea Travel.name: Fire Sea Travel
Fire Sea Travel.flavor: After your fiery attack, you open a window into the Fire Sea and skip through it to a nearby location.
Fire Sea Travel.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and the target cannot see anything farther than 3 squares from it until the end of your next turn.

Phoenix Step.name: Phoenix Step
Phoenix Step.flavor: You vanish in a sudden flare of flame, only to rise from the ashes elsewhere.
Phoenix Step.effect: Reduce the triggering fire damage to 0 and remove yourself from play until the start of your next turn. When you return to play, you reappear in any space within 10 squares of the square you left and within line of sight to that square.

Wake of Fire.name: Wake of Fire
Wake of Fire.flavor: A wave of fire streaks outward along the ground from your hand, rising up to consume what enemies you chose.
Wake of Fire.attack: Intelligence vs. Reflex. This attack ignores cover and superior cover.
Wake of Fire.effect: Make a secondary attack using the primary target as the origin square.
Wake of Fire.secondaryTarget: One creature in the blast not the primary target
Wake of Fire.secondaryAttack: Intelligence vs. Reflex. This attack ignores cover and superior cover.
Wake of Fire.secondaryeffect: Make a tertiary attack using the secondary target as the origin square.
Wake of Fire.tertiaryTarget: One creature in the blast not the primary or secondary target
Wake of Fire.tertiaryAttack: Intelligence vs. Reflex. This attack ignores cover and superior cover.

Serpents of Flame.name: Serpents of Flame
Serpents of Flame.flavor: Your arms become twin serpents of pure flame with which you harry your enemies.

bonusPower.name: Serpents of Flame Attack
bonusPower.requirement: The power Serpents of Flame must be active in order to use this power.
bonusPower.trigger: An enemy leaves a square within 2 squares of you without shifting
bonusPower.secondaryOnHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and you can slide the target 1 square.

Serpents of Flame.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and you slide the target 1 square.
Serpents of Flame.effect: You transform your arms into fiery serpents until the end of your next turn. While this effect lasts, you can use the Serpents of Flame Attack power.
Serpents of Flame.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.
Serpents of Flame.sustainStandard: The effect persists until the end of your next turn and you can repeat this power’s attacks.

Flame's Protection.name: Flame's Protection
Flame's Protection.flavor: You summon flashing wreaths of fire to buffer your allies from heat and cold, and woe to the careless enemy who tries to pierce that protection.
Flame's Protection.target: You and one or two allies in the burst
Flame's Protection.effect: The target gains resist 10 cold and resist 10 fire until the end of your next turn. Whenever a creature makes a melee attack against the target, the attacker takes 15 fire damage. No creature can take this damage more than once per turn.

Feast of Destruction.name: Feast of Destruction
Feast of Destruction.flavor: Few forces can match the awesome appetite of fire; you release it to feed.
Feast of Destruction.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and the target takes ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends).
Feast of Destruction.onMiss: Half damage and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).
Feast of Destruction.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the zone or ends its turn there takes 5 fire damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn. Creatures cannot make saving throws against ongoing fire damage while within the zone.
Feast of Destruction.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.
Feast of Destruction.sustainStandard: The zone persists until the end of your next turn, and you make the following secondary attack.
Feast of Destruction.secondaryOnHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and the target takes ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).

Fire Sigil.name: Fire Sigil
Fire Sigil.flavor: With the fire at your fingertips, you trace an ancient design onto the ground at your feet, then channel your power through it to magnificent effect.
Fire Sigil.effect: Until the end of the encounter or until you leave your square, you gain the following benefits: When making an arcane fire attack, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and a power bonus to damage rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier. You also gain a bonus to Arcana checks equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Flaming Rebuke.name: Flaming Rebuke
Flaming Rebuke.flavor: You seize the energy of your foe’s failed attack and use it to launch a fiery rebuttal.
Flaming Rebuke.trigger: An enemy misses you with an attack
Flaming Rebuke.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage. If the triggering attack was a fire attack, the target is also stunned until the end of your next turn.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.sourceRef: Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Suggestion.flavor: You weave arcane power through your words, infusing each phrase with persuasive magic.
Suggestion.effect: You make an Arcana check instead, using that result to determine the outcome of the Diplomacy check.

Arc Lightning.name: Arc Lightning
Arc Lightning.flavor: Lightning leaps from your outstretched hand, weaving safely through your allies to slam into your foes.
Arc Lightning.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage.
Level 21: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage.

Beguiling Strands.name: Beguiling Strands
Beguiling Strands.flavor: A strand of scintillating colors and gleaming lights clouds your enemies’ minds and forces them to move away.
Beguiling Strands.onHit:
Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and you push the target up to 3 squares.
Level 21: 3 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage.

Freezing Burst.name: Freezing Burst
Freezing Burst.flavor: You hurl a hailstone toward your foes. It explodes among them, temporarily turning the ground into an ice slick.
Freezing Burst.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and you can slide the target 1 square.
Level 21: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage.

Hypnotism.name: Hypnotism
Hypnotism.flavor: Your piercing gaze and whispered word let you seize momentary control of your enemy’s mind.
Hypnotism.onHit:
Choose one of the following effects:
* The target uses a free action to make a melee basic attack against a creature of your choice, with a +4 power bonus to the attack roll.
* You slide the target up to 3 squares.

Phantasmal Assault.name: Phantasmal Assault
Phantasmal Assault.flavor: A fearsome ogre appears, threatening your foe with a massive club. Or perhaps a snarling drake, or maybe a troll.
Phantasmal Assault.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target grants combat advantage and can’t make opportunity attacks until the end of your next turn.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage.

Phantom Cage.name: Phantom Cage
Phantom Cage.flavor: Your enemy shrieks in terror, desperately trying to avoid the cage of razor-sharp blades that it sees closing in around it.
Phantom Cage.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage. If the target moves before the end of your next turn, it takes 5 psychic damage.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage.

Illusory Obstacles.name: Illusory Obstacles
Illusory Obstacles.flavor: The image of treacherous terrain appears in the minds of your enemies, which become disoriented.
Illusory Obstacles.onHit: The target is dazed and unable to charge until the end of your next turn.
Illusory Obstacles.onMiss: The target is unable to charge until the end of your next turn.

Fountain of Flame.name: Fountain of Flame
Fountain of Flame.flavor: You weave a fiery pillar that spins like a top. With each revolution, it douses your enemies with searing heat.
Fountain of Flame.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any enemy that enters the zone or ends its turn there takes 5 fire damage. An enemy can take this damage only once per turn.

Instant Friends.name: Instant Friends
Instant Friends.flavor: Your magic infuses your words with the power of persuasion, clouding a creature’s mind and tricking it into thinking of you as its dearest friend.
Instant Friends.requirement: You must use this power outside a combat encounter.
Instant Friends.effect:
The target makes a saving throw. The saving throw has a +5 bonus if the target is the same level as you or a higher level. It takes a -5 penalty if the target is a lower level than you or does not have a level.
If the saving throw succeeds, this power has no effect. The target is aware that you used this power on it if it is the same level as you or a higher level. Otherwise, it does not know you used this power.
On a failed saving throw, the target treats you as a trusted friend for 1d4 hours. It truthfully answers all questions you ask and aids you in any way it can as long as doing so does not risk its life or property. While the target is under this effect, you gain a +5 power bonus to Bluff checks against it.
This effect ends if you or any of your allies attacks the target or any of its allies. Afterward, the target doesn’t remember that you used this power on it.

Blissful Ignorance.name: Blissful Ignorance
Blissful Ignorance.sourceRef: Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Blissful Ignorance.flavor: A tangle of fey magic soothes and distracts your enemies, leaving them vulnerable as they chase after pleasant dreams.
Blissful Ignorance.effect: Each target is slowed and can’t take opportunity actions or immediate actions until the end of your next turn.

Tasha's Forcible Conscription.name: Tasha's Forcible Conscription
Tasha's Forcible Conscription.flavor: By digging deep into an enemy’s mind, you unleash crippling pain that causes it to lash out blindly.
Tasha's Forcible Conscription.onHit: The target is stunned until the start of your next turn. This effect also ends if the target is attacked.
Tasha's Forcible Conscription.aftereffect: The target makes a basic attack against a target of your choice as a free action.
Tasha's Forcible Conscription.onMiss: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn. This effect also ends if the target is attacked.

Phantom Foes.name: Phantom Foes
Phantom Foes.flavor: Spectral warriors swirl around your enemies, causing them to lash out in a blind panic.
Phantom Foes.effect: Each target is slowed until the end of your next turn. Also until the end of your next turn, the first time the target makes an attack, it must make a saving throw. If the saving throw fails, you can use a free action to change the target of its attack to a different creature within range of that attack. If the target hits one of its allies with that attack, that ally takes 5 extra damage.

Phantasmal Killer.name: Phantasmal Killer
Phantasmal Killer.flavor: Your enemy wails as its greatest fears manifest within its mind.
Phantasmal Killer.effect: The target becomes haunted by an illusion of its deepest fears (save ends). Until the illusion ends, the target can’t make opportunity attacks and you can use the secondary power against it. Whenever the target is either hit by or takes damage from any effect other than the secondary power, it can make another saving throw to end the illusion.
Phantasmal Killer.requirement: The power Phantasmal Killer must be active in order to use this power.
Phantasmal Killer.attack: Intelligence vs. Will. The attack roll takes no penalty from concealment, if any.

Symphony of the Dark Court.name: Symphony of the Dark Court
Symphony of the Dark Court.flavor: Your magic unleashes an echoing song of the Feywild, corrupting your enemies in body and mind even as it grants your allies a burst of battle frenzy.
Symphony of the Dark Court.onHit: The target is dazed and immobilized (save ends both).
Symphony of the Dark Court.onMiss: The target is dazed until the end of its next turn.
Symphony of the Dark Court.effect: Each ally in the burst can shift up to 4 squares as a free action and gains a +4 power bonus to damage rolls until the end of your next turn.

Energy Devourer.name: Energy Devourer
Energy Devourer.flavor: As you shrug off an enemy’s attack, you capture that attack’s power for your own use.
Energy Devourer.trigger: You are damaged by an area attack or a close attack.
Energy Devourer.effect: You take half damage from the triggering attack. Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +5 power bonus to damage rolls with wizard attack powers that share at least one damage type with the triggering attack.

Hold Monster.name: Hold Monster
Hold Monster.sourceRef: Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
