Hold Monster.flavor: Your magic clouds your foe’s mind, leaving it too disoriented to move or attack effectively.
Hold Monster.effect: The target is restrained until the end of your next turn.

Twisting Lightning.name: Twisting Lightning
Twisting Lightning.flavor: You unleash a deadly pulse of lightning that seeks out enemies wherever you direct it.

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.flavor: A freezing blast spirals out from your outstretched hand.
Cone of Cold.effect: The target is immobilized and takes ongoing 5 cold damage (save ends both).
Cone of Cold.special: If this power reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, that enemy is petrified instead of being killed. You can end the petrification as a minor action.

Mental Maelstrom.name: Mental Maelstrom
Mental Maelstrom.flavor: The world appears to spin around your enemies, sending them careening in all directions.
Mental Maelstrom.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and you slide the target up to 4 squares.
Mental Maelstrom.onMiss: Half damage, and you slide the target up to 2 squares.
Mental Maelstrom.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. Any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes 5 psychic damage, and you can slide that enemy up to 4 squares as a free action.

Slumber of the Winter Court.name: Slumber of the Winter Court
Slumber of the Winter Court.flavor: As you whisper a slow chant, your foes suddenly stumble and sink to the ground in a magical slumber.
Slumber of the Winter Court.onHit: The target is dazed and slowed (save ends both).
Slumber of the Winter Court.firstFailedSavingThrow: The target instead falls unconscious (save ends).

Beneficient Transformation.name: Beneficient Transformation
Beneficient Transformation.flavor: Tendrils of wispy energy surround your foe, assessing and stealing away some essential aspect of its being for your own use.
Beneficient Transformation.effect:
Choose an enemy you can see. The target gains one of the following benefits until the end of the encounter.
Movement: If the enemy has a climb speed, a fly speed, or a swim speed, the target gains that movement mode and speed.
Resist: If the enemy has resistance or immunity to a damage type, the target gains resist 10 to the same damage type.
Senses: If the enemy has low-light vision, darkvision, blindsight, or tremorsense, the ally gains that sense.
If the enemy has more than one option in one of these categories, you learn all the choices and choose one when you use this power.

Dancing Flames.name: Dancing Flames
Dancing Flames.sourceRef: Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Dancing Flames.flavor: You unleash shifting streams of fire that burn down your foes while leaving allies untouched.

Mass Charm.name: Mass Charm
Mass Charm.sourceRef: Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Mass Charm.flavor: Your foes suddenly stop dead in their tracks, howling in frustration as they lurch forward to attack their own allies.
Mass Charm.effect: You slide each target up to 5 squares. Each target then makes a melee basic attack against a creature of your choice as a free action.

Thought Cage.name: Thought Cage
Thought Cage.flavor: Your foe stands dumbfounded as the world around it seems to swirl into a pleasant and mesmerizing scene.
Thought Cage.onHit: The target is stunned (save ends). This effect also ends if the target is attacked or subjected to forced movement.
Thought Cage.aftereffect: The target is dazed until the end of its next turn.
Thought Cage.onMiss: The target is dazed until the end of its next turn.

Wrath of Battle.name: Wrath of Battle
Wrath of Battle.sourceRef: Heroes of the Fallen Lands, Neverwinter Campaign Setting
Wrath of Battle.flavor: With a shout, you tap deep into your foes’ hearts and minds, forcing them to turn on each other with devastating results.
Wrath of Battle.effect: You slide each target up to 3 squares, and then each target makes a melee basic attack against a creature of your choice as a free action. If that attack misses, the target of this power takes 15 psychic damage.

Arcane Recall.name: Arcane Recall
Arcane Recall.flavor: You seek the arcane power within yourself, grasping and rebuilding the shards of a spell still echoing in your mind.
Arcane Recall.effect: You regain the use of one of your expended wizard utility powers of level 16 or lower.

Charm of False Heroism.name: Charm of False Heroism
Charm of False Heroism.flavor: Your magic twists your enemy’s loyalties, turning it into your eager vassal and accomplice.
Charm of False Heroism.onHit: You slide the target up to 6 squares, and it is dazed and immobilized until the end of your next turn. Until the end of your next turn, whenever a creature enters a square adjacent to the target, you can use an opportunity action to force the target to make a melee basic attack against that creature as a free action.
Charm of False Heroism.onMiss: You slide the target up to 6 squares, and it is immobilized until the end of your next turn.

Delayed Blast Fireball.name: Delayed Blast Fireball
Delayed Blast Fireball.flavor: You gather elemental energy and fuse it into an orb of pure arcane essence. The longer you hold it, the greater its power becomes.
Delayed Blast Fireball.effect: You create a small orb of energy that hovers by you until the end of your next turn. While the orb persists, you can use the secondary power. Once you do so, the orb is destroyed.
Delayed Blast Fireball.sustainMinor: The orb persists until the end of your next turn.
Delayed Blast Fireball.requirement: The power Delayed Blast Fireball must be active in order to use this power.
Delayed Blast Fireball.onHit: 5d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, plus 1d8 fire damage for each round you have sustained the orb (maximum 3d8).

Mind of Rage.name: Mind of Rage
Mind of Rage.flavor: With a howl of mindless anger, your foe succumbs to all its fury, fear, and pain—then unleashes its rage against its own allies.
Mind of Rage.effect: The target is affected by mind of rage (save ends). This effect also ends if you or any of your allies attacks or deals damage to the target. While the target is affected by mind of rage, at the start of its turn it charges a creature of your choice as a free action. The charge attack gains a +4 power bonus to the attack roll and the damage roll. In addition, when an ally of the target ends its turn adjacent to the target, the target makes a melee basic attack against that ally as a free action.
Mind of Rage.aftereffect: The target is dazed until the end of its next turn.

Phantasmal Dread.name: Phantasmal Dread
Phantasmal Dread.flavor: You draw forth your enemy’s greatest fears, wracking the foe with pain and holding it at bay.
Phantasmal Dread.onHit: 3d10 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target cannot willingly move closer to you until the end of your next turn.
Phantasmal Dread.effect: The target takes a -4 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn, or until it has moved at least 5 squares farther away from you than it was when you used this power.

False Reality.name: False Reality
False Reality.flavor: Your enemy is suddenly transfixed by the bliss of a pleasant dream, ignoring the tumult of battle as your allies close in for the kill.
False Reality.onHit: The target is helpless and stunned (save ends both).
False Reality.onMiss: The target is dazed until the end of its next turn.

Stone Blood.name: Stone Blood
Stone Blood.flavor: Your enemy's blood hardens, slowing its movement and causing excruciating pain.
Stone Blood.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Slimy Transmutation.name: Slimy Transmutation
Slimy Transmutation.flavor: A billowing cloud of greenish fog surrounds your foe. When the fog dissipates, your enemy is gone, and an ugly toad stands in its place.
Slimy Transmutation.onHit: The target turns into a Tiny toad (save ends).
Slimy Transmutation.onMiss: The target turns into a Tiny toad until the end of its next turn.
Slimy Transmutation.effect: As a toad, the target is dazed, and the only actions it can take are to move its speed or shift. All of the target's equipment transforms with it. If it takes damage from any source, this effect ends.

Leaden Transformation.name: Leaden Transformation
Leaden Transformation.flavor: You send a bolt of arcane energy at your foe, which deals damage and makes your foe's feet feel like blocks of lead.
Leaden Transformation.effect: The target is slowed and can't shift until the end of its next turn.

Disrupt Undead.name: Disrupt Undead
Disrupt Undead.flavor: A simple gesture causes the darkness powering and protecting an undead creature to unravel.
Disrupt Undead.effect: The target’s necrotic resistance, if any, is reduced by 5 until the end of your turn.

Spook.name: Spook
Spook.flavor: You gather the shadows to yourself, so that when you speak, your words drip with menace.
Spook.trigger: You would make an Intimidate check.
Spook.effect: You instead make an Arcana check and use that result to determine the outcome of the Intimidate check.

Restless Dead.name: Restless Dead
Restless Dead.flavor: Agitated bones break free from the ground to scrabble and claw at your enemy.
Restless Dead.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier damage. The squares adjacent to the target become a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The ground of the zone is difficult terrain for your enemies.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage.

Rotting Doom.name: Rotting Doom
Rotting Doom.flavor: You hold up your hand, palm out, and release pale wisps to infect your foes with horrid decay.
Rotting Doom.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage. If the target is undead, it also gains vulnerable 5 to all damage until the start of your next turn.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage.
Rotting Doom.effect: The target cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Scare.name: Scare
Scare.flavor: You blast an area, drawing resolve from your foes until they shrink back in abject terror.
keywords: Arcane, Fear, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow
Scare.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target cannot make opportunity attacks against you until the end of your next turn.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage.

Unraveling Dart.name: Unraveling Dart
Unraveling Dart.flavor: Gray, smoky darts leap from your fingertips to strike at your foes where they are weakest.
Unraveling Dart.onHit:
1d4 + Intelligence modifier damage. If the target has vulnerability to any damage types, the damage is of those types. If the target has no vulnerabilities, you gain a power bonus to the damage roll equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Level 21: 2d4 + Intelligence modifier damage.

Darkening Flame.name: Darkening Flame
Darkening Flame.flavor: You toss a blazing sphere of shadow-infused fire against your enemies. Where it detonates, it blackens flesh and soul.
keywords: Arcane, Fire, Implement, Necromancy, Necrotic, Shadow
Darkening Flame.effect: Each creature adjacent to the target takes fire damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Twilight Falls.name: Twilight Falls
Twilight Falls.flavor: You weave draining shadow energy into an oppressive gloom that dims your enemies’ senses.
keywords: Arcane, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow, Zone
Twilight Falls.onHit: 1d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage. If the target is in the origin square, the target is also dazed until the end of your next turn.
Twilight Falls.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. When any enemy in the zone attacks a creature, the creature has partial concealment against that enemy.

Ray of Fatigue.name: Ray of Fatigue
Ray of Fatigue.flavor: A pale gray beam leaps from your fingertip and drains strength from your foe.
Ray of Fatigue.attack: Intelligence vs. Fortitude. You have combat advantage against the target if it is bloodied.
Ray of Fatigue.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is weakened (save ends).
Ray of Fatigue.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is weakened until the end of your next turn.

Spirit Rend.name: Spirit Rend
Spirit Rend.flavor: You weave a dire spell that tears at your enemies’ spirits and holds the undead at bay.
Spirit Rend.onHit:
3d6 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
If the target is undead, it takes no damage and is not immobilized. Instead, the target must take a free action to move as far as its speed allows to a square farther away from you, and it is dazed (save ends).

Lifetaker.name: Lifetaker
Lifetaker.flavor: You crook your finger and snatch a soul as it struggles free from its body. It screams as you draw forth its energy.
Lifetaker.trigger: A nonminion living creature dies within 5 squares of you.
Lifetaker.effect: The target gains temporary hit points equal to his or her healing surge value.

Cordon of Bones.name: Cordon of Bones
Cordon of Bones.flavor: Bones tear from your enemies and spring up from the ground to form a jagged cordon.
Cordon of Bones.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Creatures take a -2 penalty to attack rolls while in the zone, and any creature that enters the zone takes 5 damage. The damage increases by 2 for each creature reduced to 0 hit points by the attack. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Ebony Razors.name: Ebony Razors
Ebony Razors.flavor: You hurl blinding shadows, then solidify them into warding shards of psychic energy.
Ebony Razors.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you have partial concealment, and when an adjacent enemy hits you with an attack, that enemy takes 5 psychic damage.

Summon Shadow Servant.name: Summon Shadow Servant
Summon Shadow Servant.flavor: The shadows swirl and coalesce into a dark creature that awaits your command.
Summon Shadow Servant.prerequisite: You must have the Expert Mage benefit associated with necromancy or nethermancy.
Summon Shadow Servant.effect:
You summon a creature associated with your necromancy or nethermancy Expert Mage benefit. The creature appears in an unoccupied space within range, and it is an ally to you and your allies.
The creature lacks actions of its own. Instead, you spend actions to command it mentally, choosing from the actions in the creature’s description. You must have line of effect to the creature to command it. When you command the creature, the two of you share knowledge but not senses.
When the creature makes an attack roll or a check, you make the roll using your game statistics, not including any temporary bonuses or penalties.
The creature lasts until it drops to 0 hit points, at which point you lose a healing surge (or hit points equal to your surge value if you have no surges left). Otherwise, it lasts until you use a minor action to dismiss it or until you use this power again.

Darklight.name: Darklight
Darklight.flavor: Purple flame appears over your head, though only you and your companions can see it. By its guidance, you can find your way.
Darklight.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. You and your allies have darkvision while in the zone.

Shadow Investiture.name: Shadow Investiture
Shadow Investiture.flavor: You draw energy from the shadow staining your soul to help others navigate the darkness.
Shadow Investiture.target: You and each ally in the burst
Shadow Investiture.effect: Until the end of the encounter, each target has darkvision and necrotic resistance equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

Ghoul Strike.name: Ghoul Strike
Ghoul Strike.flavor: You make a slashing motion against an enemy, causing darkness to bind it and filling the air around it with a charnel stench.
keywords: Arcane, Implement, Necromancy, Necrotic, Shadow, Zone
Ghoul Strike.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn. The attack creates a zone in a burst 2 centered on the target. The zone lasts for as long as the target is immobilized by this power. Any creature (except you) that ends its turn in the zone takes 5 necrotic damage, and it grants combat advantage while in the zone.
Ghoul Strike.onMiss: The power is not expended. If you use it during your next turn against the same target, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll.

Murderous Twin.name: Murderous Twin
Murderous Twin.flavor: You create a shadowy twin of your enemy, a murderous vestige that wreaks havoc on itself and its allies.
keywords: Arcane, Conjuration, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow
Murderous Twin.onHit: 5 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed until the end of its next turn.
Murderous Twin.effect: The twin vanishes and reappears in a square adjacent to the target and then makes the following attack against it.
Murderous Twin.requirement: The power Murderous Twin must be active in order to use this power.
Murderous Twin.trigger: The target leaves a square adjacent to the twin or makes an attack.

Circle of Death.name: Circle of Death
Circle of Death.flavor: You wave your hand and snuff out the lives of your enemies.
Circle of Death.onHit: The target takes necrotic damage equal to your level. It is also dazed, slowed, and weakened (save ends all).
Circle of Death.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Mirage Arcana.name: Mirage Arcana
Mirage Arcana.flavor: The terrain writhes and warps, reshaped into a sinister realm born from darkest nightmare.
keywords: Arcane, Illusion, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow, Zone
Mirage Arcana.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. The zone is difficult terrain, and creatures grant combat advantage while in it. You then make the following attack.
Mirage Arcana.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed, cannot leave the zone willingly, and cannot see creatures outside the zone (save ends all). If the target is already dazed, it takes 5 extra psychic damage.

Umbral Leap.name: Umbral Leap
Umbral Leap.flavor: You vault the distance between one shadow and another.
Umbral Leap.requirement: You must be in a square of dim light or darkness.
Umbral Leap.effect: You teleport up to 10 squares to a square of dim light or darkness. You don’t need to see the destination space to teleport, but if you can’t occupy that space, the teleportation is negated.

Wall of Gloom.name: Wall of Gloom
Wall of Gloom.flavor: Darkness billows where you gesture, forming an opaque curtain.
Wall of Gloom.effect: The wall creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone can be up to 4 squares high. The zone is heavily obscured, and squares adjacent to it are lightly obscured. The zone is difficult terrain, and creatures (except you) are blinded while they are entirely in the zone.
Wall of Gloom.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Blackening Pyre.name: Blackening Pyre
Blackening Pyre.flavor: A blazing wind swirls through your foes, carrying with it the screams of the damned.
keywords: Arcane, Fire, Implement, Necromancy, Necrotic, Shadow, Zone
Blackening Pyre.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier fire and necrotic damage, and you can slide the target 1 square.
Blackening Pyre.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the zone or ends its turn there takes 5 fire and necrotic damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Dark Gathering.name: Dark Gathering
Dark Gathering.flavor: A black mote appears in your enemies’ midst and explodes outward, projecting a wave of shadow to fog your foes’ senses.
keywords: Arcane, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow, Zone
Dark Gathering.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn. If the target is in the origin square of the burst, the target is also blinded until the end of your next turn.
Dark Gathering.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is heavily obscured to your enemies.

Enervation.name: Enervation
Enervation.flavor: Crackling black energy leaps from your fingertip to leach life from a creature.
Enervation.attack: Intelligence vs. Fortitude. If the target is bloodied, you have combat advantage for this attack.
Enervation.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage. In addition, the target is slowed, is weakened, and takes a -1 penalty to attack rolls, all defenses, skill checks, and ability checks (save ends all).
Enervation.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is weakened until the end of your next turn.
Enervation.effect: You gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value.

Dancing Shadows.name: Dancing Shadows
Dancing Shadows.flavor: You gather darkness and fling it at an ally in need. Once the shadows have done their job, they leap again to hide another ally.
Dancing Shadows.trigger: You or an ally within 10 squares of you is hit by a melee or a ranged attack.
Dancing Shadows.effect: The target gains partial concealment until the end of his or her next turn.
Dancing Shadows.aftereffect: One ally within 5 squares of the target gains partial concealment until the end of his or her next turn.

Soul Harvest.name: Soul Harvest
Soul Harvest.flavor: You catch a bit of vitality from a dying creature and twist it to your own purposes.
Soul Harvest.trigger: You reduce a living enemy to 0 hit points with necrotic damage.
Soul Harvest.target: You or one ally in the burst
Soul Harvest.effect: The target regains hit points equal to your level and can make a saving throw against one effect that a save can end.

Horrific Shadow.name: Horrific Shadow
Horrific Shadow.flavor: You gather shadow into a monstrous horror that obscures you and bites at the minds of any creature within reach.
keywords: Arcane, Illusion, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow
Horrific Shadow.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you are invisible, and any creature that ends its turn adjacent to you takes psychic damage equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier.

Soul Blight.name: Soul Blight
Soul Blight.flavor: A chiming sound presages a ring of black, roiling flames that leaves death in its wake.
keywords: Arcane, Fire, Implement, Necromancy, Necrotic, Shadow
Soul Blight.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier fire and necrotic damage. If the creature is undead, it takes no damage. It is instead dominated until the end of your next turn.
Soul Blight.effect: Each target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls and grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Acererak's Apotheosis.name: Acererak's Apotheosis
Acererak's Apotheosis.flavor: You become a vision of death as you infuse your body with shadow—your flesh draws back to the bone, and fiery blue pinpricks burn in your now-empty eye sockets.
Acererak's Apotheosis.requirement: You must have at least one healing surge.
Acererak's Apotheosis.effect:
You lose a healing surge and gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value. Until the end of the encounter, you are undead, and you gain the following benefits.
* Darkvision
* Immunity to disease and poison
* Necrotic resistance equal to 10 + one-half your level

Wraithform.name: Wraithform
Wraithform.flavor: Your body darkens and dissolves into shadowy substance, transforming you into living shadow.
Wraithform.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you have a fly speed of 6 (hover) and are insubstantial and phasing.
Wraithform.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

Animate Shadows.name: Animate Shadows
Animate Shadows.flavor: Your enemies’ shadows writhe and dance, awakened by a dread compulsion to torment your foes.
Animate Shadows.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage. Until the end of your next turn, the first time the target moves without shifting on its turn, it takes necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you can slide it 1 square as a free action.
Animate Shadows.effect: Each target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

Vampiric Strike.name: Vampiric Strike
Vampiric Strike.flavor: You sink psychic fangs into your foe so that when it suffers, you and your allies benefit.
keywords: Arcane, Healing, Implement, Necromancy, Psychic, Shadow
Vampiric Strike.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt.
Vampiric Strike.effect: The next time the target takes damage from an attack before the end of your next turn, you or one ally within 5 squares of you gains 10 temporary hit points.

Dooming Darkness.name: Dooming Darkness
Dooming Darkness.flavor: You pierce reality’s veil to let loose the dark lands’ dread influence, spilling noisome shadow among your enemies and imprisoning them in impenetrable night.
keywords: Arcane, Implement, Necrotic, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow, Zone
Dooming Darkness.target: The triggering enemy in the burst
Dooming Darkness.onHit: 10 necrotic and psychic damage, and the target is pulled up to 2 squares toward the zone’s origin square.
Dooming Darkness.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is difficult terrain and is totally obscured. Any creature that ends its turn in the zone takes 15 necrotic and psychic damage. While the zone persists, you can use the secondary power at will.
Dooming Darkness.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.
Dooming Darkness.requirement: The power Dooming Darkness must be active in order to use this power.
Dooming Darkness.trigger: An enemy leaves the zone on its turn.

Finger of Death.name: Finger of Death
Finger of Death.flavor: You point your finger and command your foe to die.
Finger of Death.onHit: 10d6 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage. If this damage bloodies the target, it takes 20 extra necrotic damage.
Finger of Death.effect: If the power reduces the target to 20 hit points or fewer, the target drops to 0 hit points.

Blazing Death Storm.name: Blazing Death Storm
Blazing Death Storm.flavor: At your gesture, flame and death erupt in a storm.
keywords: Arcane, Fire, Implement, Necromancy, Necrotic, Shadow
Blazing Death Storm.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier fire and necrotic damage.
Blazing Death Storm.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the zone or ends its turn there takes 10 fire and necrotic damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Impenetrable Gloom.name: Impenetrable Gloom
Impenetrable Gloom.flavor: Your enemies are assaulted by fright and pain as billowing darkness erupts among them.
keywords: Arcane, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow, Zone
Impenetrable Gloom.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn. If the target is in the burst’s origin square, the target is also stunned until the end of your next turn.
Impenetrable Gloom.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is totally obscured to your enemies.

Energy Drain.name: Energy Drain
Energy Drain.flavor: An unwholesome beam of darkness impales your enemy and drains vital life from its spirit.
Energy Drain.attack: Intelligence vs. Fortitude. If the target is bloodied, it grants combat advantage to you for this attack.
Energy Drain.aftereffect: The target is slowed and weakened and takes a -1 penalty to attack rolls, all defenses, skill checks, and ability checks (save ends all).
Energy Drain.effect: You gain temporary hit points equal to your healing surge value.

Moilian Flames.name: Moilian Flames
Moilian Flames.flavor: You gather shadowstuff in your hands and hurl it at a foe. As it travels, it ignites with cold blue flames that greedily devour anything they touch.
keywords: Arcane, Cold, Implement, Necromancy, Necrotic, Shadow
Moilian Flames.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier cold and necrotic damage, and the target takes ongoing 20 cold and necrotic damage (save ends). The target takes a -2 penalty to saving throws against this ongoing damage.
Moilian Flames.onMiss: Half damage, and the target takes ongoing 15 cold and necrotic damage (save ends).
Moilian Flames.effect: At the end of each of your turns, each enemy adjacent to at least one creature taking ongoing damage from this power takes ongoing 15 cold and necrotic damage (save ends).

Bladesong.name: Bladesong
Bladesong.flavor: Your whirling blade begins to sing through the air as you enter a state of total concentration.
Bladesong.requirement: You must be wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no weapon or shield in the other hand. The power’s effect ends if you stop fulfilling this requirement.
Bladesong.effect:
Until the end of your next turn, you gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls and all defenses, and a +5 power bonus to damage rolls.
Level 17: +10 power bonus to damage rolls.
Level 27: +15 power bonus to damage rolls.

Dancing Fire.name: Dancing Fire
Dancing Fire.flavor: A leaping flame dances over your enemy, driving it to distraction.
Dancing Fire.trigger: During your turn, you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack using a one-handed weapon while your other hand holds no weapon or shield.
Dancing Fire.effect:
Dexterity modifier fire damage, and the target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 2 + Dexterity modifier fire damage.
Level 21: 4 + Dexterity modifier fire damage.
Dancing Fire.special: You can use only one bladespell power per triggering attack.

Dazzling Sunray.name: Dazzling Sunray
Dazzling Sunray.flavor: You strike with your blade and from the other hand unleash a beam of brilliant light to confound your foe.
Dazzling Sunray.trigger: During your turn, you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack using a one-handed weapon while your other hand holds no weapon or shield.
Dazzling Sunray.effect:
Dexterity modifier radiant damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Level 11: 2 + Dexterity modifier radiant damage.
Level 21: 4 + Dexterity modifier radiant damage.
Dazzling Sunray.special: You can use only one bladespell power per triggering attack.

Frost Bite.name: Frost Bite
Frost Bite.flavor: Sparkling snow swirls around your enemy, numbing its limbs and making it struggle to move.
Frost Bite.trigger: During your turn, you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack using a one-handed weapon while your other hand holds no weapon or shield.
Frost Bite.effect:
Dexterity modifier cold damage, and the target is slowed until the end of its next turn.
Level 11: 2 + Dexterity modifier cold damage.
Level 21: 4 + Dexterity modifier cold damage.
Frost Bite.special: You can use only one bladespell power per triggering attack.

Lightning Ring.name: Lightning Ring
Lightning Ring.flavor: You stab your opponent, and an arc of lightning leaps from your hand to encircle a foe in a crackling ring.
Lightning Ring.trigger: During your turn, you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack using a one-handed weapon while your other hand holds no weapon or shield.
Lightning Ring.effect:
Dexterity modifier lightning damage, and the first time the target moves before the end of your next turn, it takes the lightning damage again.
Level 11: 2 + Dexterity modifier lightning damage.
Level 21: 4 + Dexterity modifier lightning damage.
Lightning Ring.special: You can use only one bladespell power per triggering attack.

Shadow Sever.name: Shadow Sever
Shadow Sever.flavor: Your attack slices away your enemy’s shadow, sending it flitting across the field to pull at the feet of a foe.
Shadow Sever.trigger: During your turn, you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack using a one-handed weapon while your other hand holds no weapon or shield.
Shadow Sever.effect:
Dexterity modifier necrotic damage, and the target falls prone if it is the same size as or smaller than the target of the triggering attack.
Level 11: 2 + Dexterity modifier necrotic damage.
Level 21: 4 + Dexterity modifier necrotic damage.
Shadow Sever.special: You can use only one bladespell power per triggering attack.

Unseen Hand.name: Unseen Hand
Unseen Hand.flavor: You level a crushing blow against your foe, and an unseen force grasps an enemy and drags it about the field of battle.
Unseen Hand.trigger: During your turn, you hit an enemy with a melee basic attack using a one-handed weapon while your other hand holds no weapon or shield.
Unseen Hand.effect:
Dexterity modifier force damage, and you slide the target up to 3 squares.
Level 11: 2 + Dexterity modifier force damage.
Level 21: 4 + Dexterity modifier force damage.
Unseen Hand.special: You can use only one bladespell power per triggering attack.

Beast Switch.name: Beast Switch
Beast Switch.flavor: You reach out to touch your foe, and for an instant it transforms into a small, frightened beast that runs in a wild panic before returning to its true shape.
Beast Switch.onHit:
1d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage. You knock the target prone and can slide it 1 square. The target cannot make opportunity attacks until the end of your next turn.
Level 21: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage.

Breath of Night.name: Breath of Night
Breath of Night.flavor: At your whisper, the chill night wind answers, a forceful gust that heeds your will.
Breath of Night.onHit:
1d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and you push the target up to a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Level 21: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage.

Witch Bolt.name: Witch Bolt
Witch Bolt.flavor: You hurl a bolt of crackling energy, forming a line of lightning between you and your foe.
Witch Bolt.onHit:
1d10 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage.
Level 21: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier lightning damage.
Witch Bolt.sustainStandard: Reroll the damage and deal it to the target again. Once the target is out of range, you can’t sustain this power.

Dread Presence.name: Dread Presence
Dread Presence.flavor: Your shadow lengthens and grows, looming over your enemies and overcoming them with dread.
keywords: Arcane, Fear, Implement, Necrotic, Nethermancy, Zone
Dread Presence.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Dread Presence.effect: The blast creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes necrotic damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Dread Presence.special: All damage from this attack and its effect ignores 5 points of necrotic resistance.

Glorious Presence.name: Glorious Presence
Glorious Presence.flavor: Radiant moonlight streams from you in all directions, and those who behold you are stricken with awe.
Glorious Presence.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage, and you push the target up to a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Glorious Presence.effect: You and each ally in the burst gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Bewitching Charm.name: Bewitching Charm
Bewitching Charm.flavor: You chant the twisting words of the bewitching charm, lulling your foes into a waking dream.
Bewitching Charm.firstFailedSavingThrow: The target is instead dazed and immobilized (save ends both).
Bewitching Charm.onMiss: The target cannot make opportunity attacks until the end of your next turn.

Charm of Forbiddance.name: Charm of Forbiddance
Charm of Forbiddance.flavor: Your voice tremulous with thunder, you invoke the charm of forbiddance on your enemy. With each further attack it makes against you, it howls its torment.
Charm of Forbiddance.effect: The target takes psychic damage equal to 2 + your Wisdom modifier whenever it hits or misses you or one of your allies (save ends).

Charm of Protection.name: Charm of Protection
Charm of Protection.flavor: The instant before a blow connects, your spell interposes a spectral object in its path.
Charm of Protection.trigger: You are hit by an attack.
Charm of Protection.effect: You gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses against the attack, and you gain temporary hit points equal to 2 + your Wisdom modifier.

Herbal Healing.name: Herbal Healing
Herbal Healing.flavor: Using a mix of herbal lore and witchcraft, you work a spell that binds a wound.
Herbal Healing.prerequisite: You must have training in Heal.
Herbal Healing.effect: The target can make a saving throw and use his or her second wind if it is available.

Simple Animation.name: Simple Animation
Simple Animation.flavor: At your command, an ordinary object springs to life and moves where you bid.
Simple Animation.target: One Medium or smaller object that is not fastened in place or held by a creature
Simple Animation.effect: The target animates until the end of your next turn, and you slide it up to 5 squares. While the target is animated by this power, you can move it farther by sliding it up to 5 squares as a move action.
Simple Animation.sustainMove: The animation persists until the end of your next turn, and you slide the target up to 5 squares.

Call the Night Winds.name: Call the Night Winds
Call the Night Winds.flavor: Howling night winds spiral around you, blotting out light, chilling your foes, and heeding your every command.
Call the Night Winds.effect: The blast creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is heavily obscured to creatures other than you, and any creature but you that starts its turn in the zone is slowed until the end of its next turn.

Grim Shadow.name: Grim Shadow
Grim Shadow.flavor: Reaching into the Shadowfell, you cast a tangible, looming shadow that strikes fear into the living.
Grim Shadow.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Grim Shadow.effect: Each target takes a -2 penalty to Will until the end of your next turn.

Foe to Frog.name: Foe to Frog
Foe to Frog.flavor: A billowing cloud of green fog surrounds your foe. When the fog dissipates, your enemy is gone, and a minuscule creature such as a frog, a newt, or a mouse stands in its place.
Foe to Frog.onHit: The target turns into a Tiny beast of your choosing (save ends).
Foe to Frog.onMiss: The target turns into a Tiny beast of your choosing until the end of its next turn.
Foe to Frog.effect: As a Tiny beast, the target is dazed, and the only actions it can take are to move its speed or shift. All of the target’s equipment transforms with it. If it takes damage from any source, this effect ends.

Savage Transformation.name: Savage Transformation
Savage Transformation.flavor: You warp your enemy’s form, changing it into a monster covered with coarse fur or scales, the flames of savagery burning in its eyes.
Savage Transformation.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you partially transform the target’s mind and body into that of a savage monster (save ends). Until this transformation ends, the target must make an opportunity attack against any creature that willingly leaves a square adjacent to it, and if any creature ends its turn adjacent to the target, the target must use a free action to deal  damage to that creature equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier.
Savage Transformation.onMiss: Half damage, and the target must make an opportunity attack against any creature that willingly leaves a square adjacent to it until the end of your next turn.

Evanesce.name: Evanesce
Evanesce.flavor: The instant you feel your enemy’s attack, you vanish in a puff of black smoke.
Evanesce.trigger: You are damaged by an attack.
Evanesce.effect: You are removed from play until the start of your next turn. The space you vacate becomes a zone that is heavily obscured and lasts until the end of the encounter. At the start of your next turn, you reappear in a square of your choice up to 5 squares from the zone.

Oracular Maneuver.name: Oracular Maneuver
Oracular Maneuver.flavor: You witnessed this encounter in a dream, and you told your companions that it would come to pass.
Oracular Maneuver.trigger: An enemy ends its turn within 5 squares of you.
Oracular Maneuver.effect: You and each ally in the burst can shift 1 square as a free action.

Revitalizing Charm.name: Revitalizing Charm
Revitalizing Charm.flavor: You crumble enchanted herbs between your fingers and command your flagging companion to steel herself or himself for battle.
Revitalizing Charm.effect: You remove one effect from the target that a save can end.

Puckish Sprite.name: Puckish Sprite
Puckish Sprite.flavor: You call forth a mischievous fey creature, aglow with fairy light and as meddlesome as a satyr.
Puckish Sprite.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage. You slide the target up to 2 squares, and it makes a basic attack as a free action against a creature of your choice.
Puckish Sprite.effect: You conjure a puckish sprite in an unoccupied square adjacent to the target. The sprite lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy of yours adjacent to the sprite takes a -4 penalty to attack rolls.

Vile Vermin.name: Vile Vermin
Vile Vermin.flavor: The ground seems to burst upward as a surge of centipedes, beetles, rats, and snakes work their way to the surface around your foe.
Vile Vermin.effect: Until the end of your next turn, any enemy that ends its turn adjacent to the target takes 5 poison damage.

Fool’s Charm.name: Fool’s Charm
Fool’s Charm.flavor: You turn your implement round and round, invoking the words to the charm that will rob your enemy of all tactical sense.
Fool’s Charm.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and you slide the target up to a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier. The target also takes ongoing 5 psychic damage (save ends).
Fool’s Charm.eachFailedSavingThrow: You slide the target up to a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Fool’s Charm.onMiss: Half damage, and you slide the target up to a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Hex of Madness.name: Hex of Madness
Hex of Madness.flavor: You incite a mob of your enemies, turning them into a frenzy of raving madness.
Hex of Madness.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Each enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes psychic damage equal to 2 + your Intelligence modifier.
Hex of Madness.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Witch Thorns.name: Witch Thorns
Witch Thorns.flavor: As you utter the command word, the vegetation at your feet writhes like snakes, twisting into a high wall of black thorns that snag those who try to pass through it.
Witch Thorns.effect: The wall creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. The zone can be up to 4 squares high and must be on a solid surface. The zone can provide partial cover and blocks line of sight. The zone is difficult terrain, and when any enemy attempts to leave a square in the zone, the creature must succeed on a saving throw or be immobilized until the start of its next turn. Once per round as a minor action, you can expand or contract the zone by 2 squares in any direction.
Witch Thorns.special: If the zone is created in an area of natural vegetation, the zone’s squares can be attacked, and it doesn’t vanish at the end of the encounter, instead remaining until destroyed. Each square of the zone has 25 hit points and vulnerable 10 fire and can be hit automatically by any attack, but it is immune to forced movement, all conditions, and attacks that target Will.

Improved Dread Presence.name: Improved Dread Presence
Improved Dread Presence.flavor: You become a great shadow made manifest, a thing of nightmare that causes your enemies to cower before you.
keywords: Arcane, Fear, Implement, Necrotic, Nethermancy, Zone
Improved Dread Presence.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Improved Dread Presence.effect: The blast creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes necrotic damage equal to your 5 + your Wisdom modifier.
Improved Dread Presence.special: All damage from this attack and its effect ignores the first 10 points of necrotic resistance.

Improved Glorious Presence.name: Improved Glorious Presence
Improved Glorious Presence.flavor: The bright light of the full moon erupts from within you, leaving thousands of glittering motes of faint light lingering nearby.
Improved Glorious Presence.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage, and you push the target up to a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Improved Glorious Presence.effect: You and each ally in the burst gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier + one-half your level.

Charm of the Dark Dream.name: Charm of the Dark Dream
Charm of the Dark Dream.flavor: As a wisp of black smoke, you enter your enemy’s mind and control it with sinister whispers.
Charm of the Dark Dream.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is dominated (save ends). Until the domination ends, you are removed from play. You can end the domination at the start of your turn. When you return to play, you appear in an unoccupied space within 5 squares of the target.
Charm of the Dark Dream.onMiss: Half damage, and you are removed from play until the start of your next turn. When you return to play, you appear in an unoccupied space within 5 squares of the target.

Hex of Woe.name: Hex of Woe
Hex of Woe.flavor: When you complete the spell, your foe resigns itself to the chill of death, leaving holes in its defenses.
Hex of Woe.onHit: 4d10 + Intelligence modifier cold and necrotic damage.
Hex of Woe.effect: The target gains vulnerable 5 to all damage (save ends).

Mare’s Body.name: Mare’s Body
Mare’s Body.flavor: You partially transform your body into that of a swift horse, a monstrous spider, a scaly lizard, or an even stranger creature.
Mare’s Body.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you transform your body from the waist down into the body of a creature with more than two legs, such as a horse, a lizard, or a giant spider. While in this form, you retain your equipment and gain +4 power bonus to speed. When you move willingly, you can choose one adjacent ally, and for each square you move you can pull that ally 1 square. Your size category also increases by one (from Medium to Large, for instance however, your weapons do not grow, and when you use a close power, you must choose a single square in your space as its origin square. You can end this form as a minor action.

Tides of Fate.name: Tides of Fate
Tides of Fate.flavor: With a cry to your mighty patron, you alter the course of fate, turning the tables on your enemies.
Tides of Fate.effect: You activate an aura 3 that lasts until you end it as a minor action or until you fall unconscious. Any ally who fails a skill check in the aura gains a +2 bonus the next time he or she makes the same kind of skill check, and any ally who fails a saving throw in the aura gains a +2 power bonus to his or her next saving throw. Any enemy in the aura that hits you or an ally in the aura grants combat advantage until the end of its next turn.

Choking Shadow.name: Choking Shadow
Choking Shadow.flavor: Your shadow separates from you and flits across the ground to throttle your enemy with spindly talons made of freezing darkness.
keywords: Arcane, Cold, Conjuration, Implement, Necrotic, Nethermancy
Choking Shadow.effect: You conjure your shadow in an unoccupied square adjacent to the target. The shadow lasts until the end of your next turn or until the target is not adjacent to it. The shadow then makes the following attack against the target.
Choking Shadow.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier cold and necrotic damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Choking Shadow.onMiss: Half damage, the target is slowed until the end of your next turn, and you cannot sustain the shadow.
Choking Shadow.sustainStandard: The shadow persists until the end of your next turn or until the target is not adjacent to it, and the shadow repeats the attack against the target.

Night Tempest.name: Night Tempest
Night Tempest.flavor: Your will is as strong as the chilling wind that comes at your call, grasping your enemies and tossing them like toys.
Night Tempest.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and you push the target up to 5 squares and knock it prone.
Night Tempest.onMiss: Half damage, and you can push the target 1 square.

Fragile Form.name: Fragile Form
Fragile Form.flavor: With a word, you transform your enemy’s body into a living doll made of glass, dry paper, or threadbare cloth.
Fragile Form.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and you transform the target’s physical form into glass, paper, cloth, or another fragile material (save ends). Until the transformation ends, the target is slowed and the target gains your choice of vulnerable 10 to all damage or vulnerable 15 fire.
Fragile Form.onMiss: Half damage, and the target gains vulnerable 5 to all damage (save ends).

Mass Transformation.name: Mass Transformation
Mass Transformation.flavor: When you utter the powerful command, your foes disappear in plumes of smoke, to be replaced by frogs, mice, hermit crabs, or some other tiny creatures.
Mass Transformation.onHit: The target turns into a Tiny beast of your choice (save ends).
Mass Transformation.aftereffect: The target takes 3d8 + your Intelligence modifier damage from the transformation.
Mass Transformation.onMiss: The target turns into a Tiny beast of your choice until the end of its next turn.
Mass Transformation.effect: As a Tiny beast, the target is dazed, and the only actions it can take are to move its speed or shift. All of the target’s equipment transforms with it. If it takes damage from any source, this effect ends.

Preserving Sleep.name: Preserving Sleep
Preserving Sleep.flavor: With words as soft as falling grains of sand, your spell places the subject into a deep slumber, preserving it from death.
Preserving Sleep.trigger: You or an ally within 20 squares of you dies.
Preserving Sleep.effect: The target does not die. All harmful effects end on him or her, and the target’s hit points reset to 0. The target falls into a stasis that resembles sleep. In this state, the target does not age, although he or she can be killed, and the target is immune to hunger, thirst, poison, disease, and suffocation. This stasis lasts until the target is healed.

Umbral Stride.name: Umbral Stride
Umbral Stride.flavor: You change into an insubstantial entity that flits from shadow to shadow.
Umbral Stride.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you are phasing, and you can use a move action to teleport up to 10 squares to a square adjacent to a creature that you can see.
Umbral Stride.sustainMinor: The effect persists until the end of your next turn.

Brutish Construct.name: Brutish Construct
Brutish Construct.flavor: Pieces of debris and discarded fragments fly together to form a lumbering construct that obeys your commands.
Brutish Construct.effect: You conjure a construct in an unoccupied square in range that lasts until the end of your next turn. The construct occupies its square, and while you are adjacent to the construct, any enemy that ends its turn adjacent to it takes 15 damage. When the construct appears, it makes the following attack.
Brutish Construct.target: One creature adjacent to the construct
Brutish Construct.onHit: 4d10 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the construct pushes the target up to 5 squares.

Horde of Puckish Sprites.name: Horde of Puckish Sprites
Horde of Puckish Sprites.flavor: Several glimmering, mischievous sprites seem to spring forth from nowhere, wreaking havoc on nearby foes.
Horde of Puckish Sprites.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage, and the target is slowed until the end of its next turn.
Horde of Puckish Sprites.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. When any enemy of yours ends its turn adjacent to one or more creatures in the zone, choose one of the creatures in the zone to make a melee basic attack against that creature as a free action.

Bewitching Gaze.name: Bewitching Gaze
Bewitching Gaze.flavor: Under the pull of your steady gaze, your foe bows to your every command.
Bewitching Gaze.onHit: 2d10 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage, and the target is dominated until the end of your next turn. On the target’s turn, you can command it to take a full set of actions (standard, move, and minor).
Bewitching Gaze.sustainStandard: You repeat the attack against the target. On a miss, the power ends.
Bewitching Gaze.onMiss: You do not expend this power.

Moonlight and Darkness.name: Moonlight and Darkness
Moonlight and Darkness.flavor: The stark, pure light of the moon mingles with darkness and shifting shadow in such concentration that it sears your enemies.
keywords: Arcane, Evocation, Implement, Necrotic, Radiant, Zone
Moonlight and Darkness.onHit: 4d8 + Intelligence modifier radiant and necrotic damage.
Moonlight and Darkness.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Allies in the zone have partial concealment. Enemies in the zone have vulnerable 10 radiant and vulnerable 10 necrotic, and they grant combat advantage.

Supreme Dread Presence.name: Supreme Dread Presence
Supreme Dread Presence.flavor: You become a vision of nightmare, cloaking yourself in the dread shadow that is inexorably bound to you, wrapping it around you like a mantle.
keywords: Arcane, Fear, Implement, Necrotic, Nethermancy, Zone
Supreme Dread Presence.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is slowed until the end of your next turn.
Supreme Dread Presence.effect: The blast creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes necrotic damage equal to your 10 + your Wisdom modifier.
Supreme Dread Presence.special: All damage from this attack and its effect ignores 15 points of necrotic resistance.

Supreme Glorious Presence.name: Supreme Glorious Presence
Supreme Glorious Presence.flavor: As the light of your radiance repels your enemies, it also brings them to their knees before you, giving your allies a chance to draw near and rejuvenate themselves.
Supreme Glorious Presence.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier radiant damage, and you push the target up to a number of squares equal to your Wisdom modifier and knock the target prone.
Supreme Glorious Presence.effect: You and each ally in the burst gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier + one-half your level.

Augury.name: Augury
Augury.flavor: You read the mystic signs and glean a notion of the future.
Augury.requirement: You must use this power during an extended rest.
Augury.effect: You ask a question and receive a vague notion of the future. You might receive a clue as to whether a specific course of action is likely to have positive or negative results. This notion can take the form of a single image, a hint about a danger that might be faced, or just a positive or negative feeling about the current course of destiny.

Chameleon’s Mask.name: Chameleon’s Mask
Chameleon’s Mask.flavor: You pull strands of shadow, blending your colors and sounds with your surroundings to help you hide from your enemy’s sight and hearing.
Chameleon’s Mask.effect: You make an Arcana check instead, using that result to determine the outcome of the Stealth check.

Water Stride.name: Water Stride
Water Stride.flavor: You speed across a liquid surface as if it were solid ground.
Water Stride.effect: Until the end of your next turn, you can treat liquid surfaces as if they were solid ground but difficult terrain.

Whispering Wind.name: Whispering Wind
Whispering Wind.flavor: You speak a message to the wind and let it carry your words to an audience you choose.
Whispering Wind.effect: You cause a breeze to carry a message of up to 25 words or a sound up to 6 seconds long to a place you choose. The destination must be within a number of miles equal to your Intelligence modifier and must be familiar to you, and it must be a location that the wind can reach. Once you complete the message or the sound, the wind travels at speed 5 (or 1 mile per hour) until it reaches the destination, where it conveys the message or the sound regardless of whether anyone hears it.
Whispering Wind.special: You can have one whispering wind active at a time.

Flame Arrow.name: Flame Arrow
Flame Arrow.flavor: By pointing at a projectile or a ranged weapon, you cause it to be wreathed in flame.
Flame Arrow.target: You and each ally in the burst
Flame Arrow.effect:
The next ranged weapon attack that each target makes before the end of your next turn deals 1d6 extra fire damage.
Level 21: 2d6 extra fire damage.

Howling Wall.name: Howling Wall
Howling Wall.flavor: A screaming wind gusts across the battlefield, buffeting creatures in its path.
Howling Wall.onHit: You slide the target up to 2 squares, and it is slowed until the end of your next turn.

Watery Sphere.name: Watery Sphere
Watery Sphere.flavor: A single water droplet expands to overtake your enemies, trapping them inside an enormous watery sphere.
Watery Sphere.onHit: The target is immobilized and grants combat advantage (save ends both).
Watery Sphere.onMiss: You must slide the target up to 3 squares to a square adjacent to the burst.
Watery Sphere.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is difficult terrain, and it grants partial cover to creatures on opposite sides of it. You can use a move action to move the zone up to 3 squares. If you do so, any creatures immobilized by this power and in the zone slide up to 3 squares, staying inside the zone. When a creature enters the zone or starts its turn there, you can use an immediate reaction to make the attack against that creature.
Watery Sphere.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.

Wind Blade.name: Wind Blade
Wind Blade.flavor: The moaning wind becomes a shrill whistle as you turn it into a blade perfect for slashing through your foes.
Wind Blade.effect: You conjure a blade of solid wind in an unoccupied square within range. The blade lasts until the end of your next turn. Enemies adjacent to the blade grant combat advantage. You can use a move action to move the blade to a square within range. When the blade appears, it makes the following attack, and while the blade persists, you can repeat the attack as a standard action.
Wind Blade.target: One creature adjacent to the blade
Wind Blade.onHit: 2d6 + Intelligence modifier force damage, and you can slide the target 1 square.
Wind Blade.sustainMinor: The blade persists until the end of your next turn.

Flare.name: Flare
Flare.flavor: Multicolored sparks, sizzles, and sparks erupt from the fire and provide a momentary distraction.
Flare.effect: The burst creates a zone of bright light that lasts until the end of your next turn. Creatures in the zone have partial concealment.

Protection from Missiles.name: Protection from Missiles
Protection from Missiles.flavor: A wave of your hand calls forth a protective wind to disperse arrows and other missiles headed your way.
Protection from Missiles.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. While in the zone, you and your allies gain a +4 power bonus to all defenses against ranged weapon attacks.

Fire Mantle.name: Fire Mantle
Fire Mantle.flavor: You wreathe yourself or an ally in protective fire, which punishes nearby foes.
Fire Mantle.effect:
You activate an aura 1 on the target that lasts until the end of the encounter or until the target dismisses it as a minor action. When any enemy enters the aura or ends its turn there, that enemy takes fire damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. An enemy can take this damage only once per turn.
In addition, until the aura ends, the target has partial concealment and resist 10 fire.

Ice Knife.name: Ice Knife
Ice Knife.flavor: Hurling a blade of ice against your foe causes the ice to explode into jagged shards that tear through anything they hit.
Ice Knife.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the primary target is immobilized (save ends).
Ice Knife.secondaryTarget: Each creature in the burst other than the primary target
Ice Knife.secondaryOnHit: 5 cold damage, and the secondary target takes a -2 penalty to AC (save ends).

Conjure Fortification.name: Conjure Fortification
Conjure Fortification.flavor: A low stone wall rises from the ground, offering cover against attack or passage over an obstacle.
Conjure Fortification.effect: You conjure a wall of stone. The wall can be up to 1 square high, and at least 2 squares of it must rest on a solid surface. The wall lasts until the end of the encounter. The wall is blocking terrain. A creature can climb the wall with a DC 15 Athletics check.

Watery Double.name: Watery Double
Watery Double.flavor: Creating a duplicate of yourself from elemental water lets you cast spells from unexpected directions.
Watery Double.effect: You conjure a watery double of yourself in an unoccupied square within range. The double occupies its space, and it lasts until the end of your next turn. Until the conjuration ends, you can use your space or the double’s space as the origin for your wizard attack powers.

Death Smoke.name: Death Smoke
Death Smoke.flavor: Great, billowing clouds of noxious smoke spread death and decay to your enemies.
keywords: Arcane, Implement, Necromancy, Necrotic, Poison, Shadow, Zone
Death Smoke.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic and poison damage.
Death Smoke.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Squares in the zone are lightly obscured. Any creature that enters the zone or ends its turn there takes 5 necrotic and poison damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn. You can move the zone up to 3 squares as a move action.
Death Smoke.sustainMinor: The zone moves 1d4 squares in a random direction, and it persists until the end of your next turn.

Earthen Grasp.name: Earthen Grasp
Earthen Grasp.flavor: A great fist rises from the ground to smash your enemies flat.
Earthen Grasp.effect: You conjure a Large earthen fist on the ground in an unoccupied space within range. The fist lasts until the end of your next turn. The fist occupies its space, and you and your allies can flank with it. While the fist persists, you can use the secondary power at will.
Earthen Grasp.sustainMinor: The fist persists until the end of your next turn.
Earthen Grasp.requirement: The power Earthen Grasp must be active in order to use this power.
Earthen Grasp.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target falls prone.

Melf’s Minute Meteors.name: Melf’s Minute Meteors
Melf’s Minute Meteors.flavor: Tiny balls of fire wink into existence around your head, awaiting your command to streak toward a foe and detonate.
Melf’s Minute Meteors.effect: Five fiery globes appear in the air around your head and hover there until they are expended or until the end of the encounter. While at least one globe remains, you can use the secondary power once per round, and any adjacent enemy that hits you with an attack takes 3  fire damage for each globe remaining.
Melf’s Minute Meteors.requirement: The power Melf's Minute Meteors must be active in order to use this power.
Melf’s Minute Meteors.onHit: 2d4 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends). If the target is already taking ongoing fire damage, that damage increases by 5. One globe is expended.

Dig.name: Dig
Dig.flavor: You cause earth and stone to pull apart, creating a deep pit or a shortcut to a different location.
Dig.effect: You create a hole on an unoccupied horizontal or vertical surface within range. The hole’s opening can be up to 2 squares on a side. The hole’s depth is up to a number of squares equal to twice your Intelligence modifier. Unless the DM rules otherwise, the hole does not destabilize the material around it. A creature can climb the hole’s walls with a DC 20 Athletics check.

Flowing Evasion.name: Flowing Evasion
Flowing Evasion.flavor: Assuming a watery form lets your target slither through the enemy ranks to get into position to make a attack or to escape.
Flowing Evasion.target: You or one ally in the burst
Flowing Evasion.effect: The target can use a free action to shift up to a number of squares equal to your Intelligence modifier. The target can shift through enemy spaces.

Gale Wall.name: Gale Wall
Gale Wall.flavor: A wall of gusting wind slows movement and deflects missiles.
Gale Wall.effect: You conjure a wall of wind that lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall can be up to 4 squares high. Any creature that starts its turn in the wall or adjacent to it is pushed 1d4 squares away from it. Moving through a square of the wall costs 2 extra squares of movement. In addition, a creature has superior cover against any ranged weapon attack that passes through the wall.
Gale Wall.sustainMinor: The wall persists until the end of your next turn.

Fiery Constrictor.name: Fiery Constrictor
Fiery Constrictor.flavor: Elemental fire flows out from a single point to form into a slithering serpent that coils about your enemies and crushes them in its fiery embrace.
Fiery Constrictor.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and the target is restrained and takes ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends both).
Fiery Constrictor.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).

Summon Invisible Stalker.name: Summon Invisible Stalker
Summon Invisible Stalker.flavor: A relentless killer emerges from the Elemental Chaos to stalk your foe and strangle it to death.
Summon Invisible Stalker.effect:
You summon an invisible stalker in an unoccupied space within range. The creature is an ally to you and your allies.
The invisible stalker lacks actions of its own. Instead, you spend actions to command it mentally, choosing from the actions in the creature’s description. You must have line of effect to the creature to command it. When you command the creature, you and the creature share knowledge but not senses.
When the creature makes a check, you make the roll using your game statistics, not including any temporary bonuses or penalties.
The creature lasts until it drops to 0 hit points, at which point you lose a healing surge (or hit points equal to your surge value if you have no surges left). Otherwise, it lasts until you dismiss it as a minor action or until the end of the encounter.

Vitriolic Sphere.name: Vitriolic Sphere
Vitriolic Sphere.flavor: The orb of acid you hurl against your opponent burns your target severely and splashes out to catch anyone nearby.
Vitriolic Sphere.onHit: 3d6 + Intelligence modifier acid damage, and the target grants combat advantage and takes ongoing 10 acid damage (save ends both).
Vitriolic Sphere.onMiss: Half damage, and the target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
Vitriolic Sphere.effect: Each creature adjacent to the target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn and takes acid damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Alter Self.name: Alter Self
Alter Self.flavor: You alter your features until you become a stranger to all who know you.
Alter Self.effect:
You alter your physical form to take on the appearance of any humanoid of your size category. You retain your game statistics in your new form. Your clothing and other equipment are unchanged. To impersonate a specific individual, you must have seen that individual.Your new form lasts until you use this power again or until you end it as a minor action.
Any creature can discern that your form is a disguise by making an Insight check opposed by your Bluff check. You gain a +5 power bonus to your check.

Cloud Form.name: Cloud Form
Cloud Form.flavor: Your body and equipment dissolve into a misty cloud. While in this form, you can move through any opening.
Cloud Form.effect: You assume a cloudy form until the end of the encounter or you use a minor action to dismiss it. While in this form, you are insubstantial, you have a fly speed of 6 (hover), and you gain a +5 power bonus to Stealth checks. In addition, you cannot attack and you cannot use any of your equipment. You can move through small holes or narrow openings large enough to permit smoke or air.

Horrid Wilting.name: Horrid Wilting
Horrid Wilting.flavor: Crimson droplets fly from the target as your spell pulls the moisture from its body. Flesh withers, bones creak, and a dry whistle escapes from your opponent as its pain mounts.
Horrid Wilting.onHit: 9d4 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is slowed and weakened (save ends both). If the target has the aquatic or the water keyword, it takes 10 extra damage.
Horrid Wilting.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is slowed (save ends).

Landslide.name: Landslide
Landslide.flavor: Stones, pebbles, and debris tumble away from you in a tremendous flood of earth that sweeps through everything in its path.
Landslide.onHit: 4d6 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target falls prone.
Landslide.effect: The blast creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The ground of the zone is difficult terrain. You can take a move action to push the zone and each creature in it up to 3 squares.
Landslide.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn, and each creature in the zone takes 5 damage.

Command Water.name: Command Water
Command Water.flavor: The waters froth and tumble in response to your command, rising, falling, or parting to create a dry path.
Command Water.requirement: You must use this power during a short or an extended rest.
Command Water.target: A lake or a stretch of river that has a diameter in miles of your Intelligence modifier or less.
Command Water.effect:
Choose one of the following effects. The effect lasts until your next extended rest or until you dismiss it as a standard action.
You reduce or increase the water’s depth by a number of feet up to your Intelligence modifier.
You create a dry path through the water. The path is up to 30 feet wide and extends from one shore to the other shore by the shortest distance, from your side of the water to the opposite side.

Living Iron.name: Living Iron
Living Iron.flavor: As the spell takes effect, the target’s body screeches as its flesh darkens to polished black iron.
Living Iron.effect:
The target assumes the form of living iron. The form lasts until the target is affected by another polymorph effect, until you take a minor action to dismiss it, or until the end of the encounter. While in this form, the target gains vulnerable 20 lightning and is slowed. In addition, the target gains the following benefits.
Resist 10 to all damage.
Immunity to blindness, deafness, disease, and poison.
No need to breathe, and thus cannot suffocate.
+6 power bonus to melee damage rolls.

Reverse Gravity.name: Reverse Gravity
Reverse Gravity.flavor: A ferocious wind snatches your foes and wrenches them up into the air, carrying them so high that they almost vanish from view.
Reverse Gravity.onHit: The target rises 40 feet off the ground, and it hovers there immobilized (save ends). If the target cannot rise the full distance (due to a ceiling or some other blocking terrain), it takes 1d10 damage for every 10 feet it is prevented from rising.
Reverse Gravity.eachFailedSavingThrow: The target rises 20 more feet, and it takes 1d10 damage for every 10 feet it is prevented from rising.
Reverse Gravity.onMiss: The target falls prone, and it cannot stand up (save ends).

Rime Beasts.name: Rime Beasts
Rime Beasts.flavor: Elemental water bubbles up from the ground and freezes into monstrous shapes that obey your every command.
Rime Beasts.effect: You conjure four Medium rime beasts in unoccupied squares within range. The rime beasts occupy their spaces and last until the end of your next turn. The rime beasts can be attacked. They share your defenses and have 20 hit points each. Any enemy that starts its turn in a square adjacent to a rime beast takes 10 cold damage and is slowed until the start of its next turn. In addition, while the rime beasts remain, you can take the following special actions.
Rime Beasts.standardAction: Each rime beast makes the following attack. Melee 1 (one enemy Intelligence vs. Fortitude; 2d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is restrained until the end of your next turn.
Rime Beasts.moveAction: You move each rime beast up to 4 squares.
Rime Beasts.sustainMinor: The beasts persist until the end of your next turn.

Crack the World.name: Crack the World
Crack the World.flavor: The ground shudders and pulls apart to form a deep chasm into which your enemies fall.
Crack the World.onHit: The target is removed from play and takes ongoing 30 damage (save ends both).
Crack the World.aftereffect: The target returns to play prone in a square adjacent to the wall.
Crack the World.onMiss: The target takes 15 damage, and you push it up to 3 squares away from the wall.
Crack the World.effect: The wall’s space on the ground becomes a chasm 80 feet deep. A creature can climb the chasm’s walls with a DC 31 Athletics check.

Devastating Whirlwind.name: Devastating Whirlwind
Devastating Whirlwind.flavor: A whirling column of wind rips across the landscape, hurling creatures into the air.
Devastating Whirlwind.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier damage, and the target is immobilized and takes ongoing 15 damage (save ends both).
Devastating Whirlwind.aftereffect: You push the target up to 6 squares away from the burst’s origin, and the target falls prone.
Devastating Whirlwind.onMiss: You push the target up to 6 squares away from the burst’s origin, and the target falls prone.
Devastating Whirlwind.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any creature that ends its turn in the zone takes 10 damage and falls prone. You can take a move action to move the zone up to 8 squares, and any immobilized or prone creature in it slides with it, remaining in position in the zone.
Devastating Whirlwind.sustainStandard: The zone persists until the end of your next turn, and you can repeat the attack against each creature in the zone, although this attack has no effect on a miss.

Flash Freeze.name: Flash Freeze
Flash Freeze.flavor: An arcane wind blasts elemental cold at your foes and freezes them in their tracks.
Flash Freeze.onHit: 7d6 + Intelligence modifier cold damage, and the target is petrified until the end of your next turn.
Flash Freeze.aftereffect: The target is slowed and takes ongoing 10 cold damage (save ends both).
Flash Freeze.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is restrained until the end of your next turn.
Flash Freeze.effect: The blast creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Squares in the zone are difficult terrain. Any creature knocked prone in the zone takes 10 extra cold damage.

Incendiary Cloud.name: Incendiary Cloud
Incendiary Cloud.flavor: A fiery bead rapidly expands into a burning cloud that consumes everything it touches.
Incendiary Cloud.onHit: 3d8 + Intelligence modifier fire damage, and ongoing 20 fire damage (save ends).
Incendiary Cloud.effect: The target’s space and each square adjacent to it become a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. The zone is lightly obscured, and any creature that ends its turn in the zone takes ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends).
Incendiary Cloud.sustainMinor: The zone’s size increases by 1, and the zone persists until the end of your next turn.
